A vibrant slice of history. I'm always amazed at how much of the history of The Rocks is embraced in the daily business and lives of the area. The old stories are shared, the architecture is celebrated, the tragedies are remembered.Each time I get to Sydney, I find time to return here.

Hustle and bustle. What's not to like about this place. Go when the markets are on and there's the smell of good food, buskers singing away, busy market stalls to wander around, artwork everywhere and more good food.Excellent way to spend a few hours before or after checking out or climbing the bridge!

Great area for tourists. We stayed in this spot whilst attending a conference for a week. The rocks is like a suburb that sits around circular quay and the harbour bridge. It is a really picturesque area with lots of little cobbled lanes, old terrace houses and cute pubs. There are so many places to eat and drink which is perfect for tourists or business when you need something nearby. The area is also close to the actual cbd and transport with circular quay right there and the train station too. Recommend.

sydneys early days. Interesting part of early Sydney beginnings.walk the back streets for good views of how Sydney began. Information office is convenient and plenty of maps etc. site of the first hotel in Sydney. Old steps leading down to the quay show how they are worn by numerous people over the years. Good cafes and hotels.also the ken done gallery is here.
The Rocks . Interesting place if you like a bit of history. Lots of outdoor stalls and shops as well as eating places. Highly recommend the noodle bar ☺

Worth a Visit. This is one of the few old parts of Syndey. It's lovely to wonder around the shops and markets. Lots of places to eat. Plus the Art Gallery shop is worth a visit. You can take a walk across the Harbour Bridge from here.
Great history. Lovely part of Sydney, a lot of the buildings have been restored and there is a great market on at the weekends. Nice to wander round and take pictures
Holiday . Great place to eat walk around good places lots of history love the Fish at the Rocks nice bars good history
Great food and shopping at the Markets. Always enjoy a wander around the Rocks area for a bite to eat and shopping at the Market stalls is always fun.
Do a ghost tour, its worth it. Do a ghost tour, its great and you learn alot of history. The pubs are always crowded on the weekend but that is all you would expect

Birthday surprise. The rocks is a great place to go and spend the night whether your a local or a visitor. There is always something new to see. The old world buildings from the convict era and the new buildings. Last trip I saw the excavations under the ymca hostel which was very educating. Can't wait to go back again

Great Insight into History and educational. Great Insight into History and educational This walk will give a great insight ino the history of Sydney and how it was developed and discovered See buildings that were carebed form original sand stone and made form First fleet tools Great experience and insight into Australia settlement
Lots of History. The Rocks has a lot to offer and history. Many good restaurants and street venders. You can really feel old town Sydney when in "The Rocks."

Highlite. The Rocks is a fun place to visit as a tourist or a Sydney sider. It has lots to offer from enjoying a walk & admiring the scenery, Shops, Boutiques, Restaurants & Markest to name a few. There is generally free entertainment on the weekends with a variety of Buskers. Anything from a sit down Restaurant or cafe to take away/find a seat & watch the world go by.

Sydney History. Check out the original old world building while walking on cobble stone streets . Plenty of places to eat or pop in for a coffee. Try out the old style Pub for a cool beer. Markets every weekend
A delightful walk.... Full of restaurants and interesting places to wander thru. Enjoy the open market which has many locally made crafts and delicious food

Many alleys and streets to explore. If you like wandering through alleys and back streets (in safety), then The Rocks is the place. There is a rich heritage here and many old buildings and homes to see. There's the Big Dig, Susannah Place Museum and The Rocks Markets to name a few sites. Great activity for a sunny day in Sydney.

I love the Rocks.. The Rocks has such a great vibe, it's lovely just to wander the streets, taking in iconic Sydney history. The weekend market, whilst clearly for the tourists, is still a great way to spend a couple of hours. The Rocks museum, & the variety of street based information panels are all great & add to the interest. Lots of hotels & bars to pop into & the bridge looming every large overhead. Well worth some of your time in Sydney, in my view.
Great place to visit - Aussie History. Love walking around the rocks especially on the weekend. Great things always going on. Markets are always good too. See a bit of Australia's history!
Shopping . I went on a market day. It was lovely to walk around all the history whilst looking at all the great market stalls underneath the great bridge. A must whilst visiting Sydney.
Good to see. Very important place to see the story start there. We found a good place for had a cold nice stone lager is just behind the museum near the cruise port easily to fund

Touch some colonial history. Fabulous part of old Sydney town, were you can touch the convict hewn stones at the foundation of the city. Apart from some great old buildings and interesting architecture, there are some great eclectic places to shop (although touristy and some quite expensive) it is still a great place to wander around. Friday night had pop up food stalls with some tasty treats, and markets on the week-end. Love this part of Sydney!

A fascinating part of Australia's history. This fabulous part of Australia's history is right on the doorstep of the CBD and is a great place for an educational ramble.While only a small area, you can spend as much or as little time as you choose in The Rocks and enjoy every minute of it.Historic buildings, boutique shops, cafes and restaurants, old pubs etc, this area has something for everyone with fabulous views of Sydney Harbour Bridge, the harbour and Opera House.
Interesting place to visit!. We went there on a Saturday. We loved the market there and the history of early European Settlement. Museum worth visiting.

Always a treat to visit. I stayed in the heart of The Rocks and found lots of great places to shop and eat.Look out for unexpected sights. I liked the Nurses Walk with its illuminated figures on the wall.I recommend a visit to The Rocks.
Really Good Market. Really enjoyed the extensive choice at The Rocks Market. Certainly worth a visit & a stroll around all of the stalls

WHERE IS THE ROCK?. A place of early migrants from Europe depicting the life they had led. It is rather touristy with many shops surrounding the main street & supported by mobile booths selling handicraft items & so on. It's a nice experience to go around and nearby walking distance is the jetty for the Sydney harbour cruise.

Great place. Went on a Saturday an the markets were on, great variety of things to buy, some food tents to get cheap food or great restaurant and cafes and pubs for food. Can start the walk on the bridge from here. Great old buildings and amazing history. Must visit when in Sydney.

Great place to stay and use as a base to see Sydney . We have stayed at various locations across the Sydney CBD and have found the Rocks the vest location to stay easy to access public transport and a wide range of food outlets at hand. Would recommend this location to anyone.

Old Sydney.....first area settled.. This area is now very historic and also has become an expensive place to live. Originally it was where the poorer people resided. Sailors from the ships patronised the (now) old hotels. And where the first Sydney hospital was situated., and the nurses lived (Nurses walk). The prime place to reside was back on the hill where the Sydney Museum now is. Perhaps it would be a good idea to get a guide if you are a visitor to Sydney.....see the cobbled streets, Garrison Church where the convicts were taken, and much more. Argyle cut where the "hanging tree" was. Rock cuttings with old dwellings still visible.Many historic buildings....John Cadman's cottage, the water used to come up to this, where he would repair the boats. Old banks and old Police Building. Beautiful old shop fronts (if you like this kind of thing) now selling modern goods. Tank Stream can be seen at low tide exiting at the western end of Circular Quay wharves. VERY INTERESTING IF YOU HAVE THE TIME TO LOOK AROUND.

Day out on the harbour. When at Circular Quay for a days sight seeing this area is a must. There is history here and some of the remaining historical buildings are magnificant. Pleasant walking in well maintained and clean areas.
Beautiful area to visit any day . Lovely place so many local traders and artists... Love spending time there. There's everything in Rocks area . Restaurants or shopping whatever I want..
Visited as part of our free walking tour. A great part of the city - lots of bars, shops and restaurants with a facinating history - well worth a visit

THE ROCKS-----ROCKS!!!!!!!!!!. Get off the ferry,bus or train at one of Sydneys main transport hubs for the Harbour,Opera House or Rocks area.The Rocks is only a 5-10 minute walk& you will not be disappointed.Old bonded warehouses turned into docksiderestaurants & cafes & shops galore.Lots of old pubs like The Nelson & Hero of Waterloo,Phillips Foot & more.You are virtually under the Harbour Bridge& have access to wharves where you can shop,eat or even go to the theatre.Not far away is access to Darling Harbour & the new precinct of Barangaroowhere the new casino is well on the way & you have breath taking views ofSydney Harbour .At the weekend there is a great market & you can't missthis opportunity to visit THE ROCKS.

Shopping!!. We loved touring "The Rocks"...lots of shopping, great restaurants and even went through the Art Museum. We visited farmers market and a coffee festival which was so fun. All the merchants were so helpful....
Good place to visit during the weekends. Because apart from the historic buildings, you can also browse the offerings at the weekend open-air market.

Perfect location for a Quick Trip to Sydney. Love the Rocks! Restaurants, shops, and galleries galore make this a great place to stay if you are in Sydney on a short visit. Proximity to the Quay makes transportation around the area super easy, too.
Old Buildings. This is one of my favourite places. If you can appreciate classic themed buildings, then this spot is perfect.I just love the structures of the building and the red bricks. :D

Lovely historic area. Beautiful area with lots of cafes, hotels and nice shops. Sunday morning has a great market with lots of nice hand made jewellery, candles, clothing, and much more. There was some great buskers to add to the atmosphere.
Great food. We visited a Japanese restaurant, a sushi bar walking distance from Park Hyatt Hotel. Sake. Beautiful dishes, original and beautifully presented
Comfy place to hangout with friends and chill. The argyle bar is good. Pancake on the Rock has tasty ribs. The views around here is beautiful no matter day and night. Love it.

Never miss it everytime I visit.!. I enjoy a weekend visit to the Rocks for the vibrancy, the markets, the history and the creativity of the Contemporary Arts museum.The ferries, the Opera House, the gardens, the buskers...the whole area has a buzz! My irregular Sydney visits is not complete unless I visit this precinct.

Great section of the City. This charming little section of Syney is adorable. Great upscale shopping, amazing restaurants, quaint cafes, the Sydney harbor bridge and museums and even some souvenir shops. Give yourself a few hours to explor this area.

Great area on the Harbor. Quaint area with lots of shops and restaurants. The area borders the Sydney Harbor and the Bridge. There's a great pub near the bridge climb that serves kangaroo and emu pizza. Tasty!

Strong concept. "Made by many hands" is The Rocks slogan and if you dig deeper: you will find why. This place needs investigastion, so don't expect the full experience if you just take a stroll. Discover and get lost in th oldest (Western) part of Australia. Restaurants and bars are 5 stars, small streets an steps brings you to genuine places. A tip: the Rocks market is to small. Upgrade it, double the stands.

The Rocks has gone quiet. Having been to The Rocks many times before, I was disappointed at how it felt like it had lost its edge & was a lot quieter than on previous visits. This is a lovely area with lots of history & I am hoping that it can regain its vibrancy.

Many restaurants and cafes. The neighborhood is not very interesting , but there are many cafes, shops and restaurants. Night is not very lively.
I think that this was the first colony in Australia.
Funky place . Great to go for a few drinks with your partner or friends. You can really see Sydney's history here. Few cool shops and places to eat also. Would defiantly give it a go.

Awesome market on weekends. Fantastic market! Artisans, food, antiques...a little bit for every person. My kids had a blast. The Turkish cozleme stand had these amazing crepe/ like breads filled with cheese and spinach....
We had a great time there. Very walkable.

Good walking tour that you can do on your own. . Visit the Rocks, it's well signposted and the Lonely Planet guide book also has a walking route that you can do yourself. It's an interesting part of history, well signposted and information is put around the area too. Lovely range of bars and restaurants here too - and the streets are so clean!!
The Rocks rock. Great feel to the place, especially if you can get over to the area on a Saturday when the street markets are on, lots of great souvenirs & tasty foods on offer

Must See!. The Rocks is the old part of Sydney, and the buildings there are original from early settlement days. Lots of great little boutique shops to explore, cafes and getting into the vibe of old Sydney. A must see, and lots of good photo opportunities.

Tourist Rip Off but History Lovers Delight. Expensive place to take visitors so avoid shopping here as there are many places one can shop for at much cheaper prices. However as a reminder of old Sydney it is beautiful. Also many eating options here.
Nice historical part of Sydney. Good way to spend a few hours exploring the old part of Sydney, lots of nice cafes and restaurants. Nice little cobbled alleways to explore.

A BRILLIANT PLACE TO VISIT. We are Sydney siders and have had the pleasure of visiting the Rocks many times but recently had some interstate visitors and enjoyed the place from a tourists prospective. If you are interested in history, the buildings in the Rocks are amazing from the terrace residential homes, to the fantastic pubs & bars. We did the markets, these are not your cheap & nasty markets, but lovely, quality items including prints, glassware, jewellry, clothing & home wares. We did the obligatory pub crawl that included the Harbour View (where we had lunch & watched the Bridge climbers going up & down, The Orient & Fortune of War, it is great fun to do a pub crawl, chatting to plenty of tourists, trying Aussie beers with maybe some music along the way. Just stroll around and enjoy the ambiance it is a great place to visit.
Awesome area. Loved this area of Sydney. Spent a lot of time here as I stayed at the Four Seasons just a short couple minute walk away. The weekend market was a hit as well as the cute restaurants.

Australian kind of place!. My wife is a shopper....I am not, yet even I enjoyed some of the shops and especially the foodie markets. I bought an inexpensive kangaroo wallet and we had crocodile, lamb and alligator kabob options. Plenty of really good restaurants and just a fun place to hang out.

Rocks on Sunday's. The Rocks, steeped in history and has a market place on weekends. This is good for the unusual and Aussie souvenirs and just great to amble around for the atmosphere. A wide range of hotels and eating places abound and Circular Quay on the doorstep, with its restaurants, the famous ferries and cruises on the most beautiful harbour in the world.. Most of the pubs/hotels have bands playing on the weekends lunchtime to about 5 pm which is great to have a drink, a nice meal and to while away your time in good company listening to the music.

Historical ground- love it. The Rocks Sydney can basically best be described with photos. Beside helding the oldest buildings in Australia it offers amazing restutants and city view of both The Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Sydney Skyline. All Australia window to the world in one place. You can not go to Australia and not visit the Rocks.I was there in 89, 94 and now 2016...for sure I will be back

History. Wander through the ally s and take in the history,Nurses walk etc. Lovely cafes and shops .look for numbers of doors to find eg 75 1/2 .Visit at weekend Saturday and Sunday, great Street market .

Check out the cafes and chill out. A very unique establishment , find some café , order food and chill out there on the alley between natural rock building . Stroll around and explore, you may get many good photo shot.
THE ROCKS. I was disappointed with the decline in quirky stores that used to be in this area. It is a great shame that 'Sailors Thai' is closing. I visit each time I come to Sydney.

love this place very buzzing. What a place to go and visit, a simply must place, a buzzing and very mixed with different types of people and food trip and wine, good vibes been several times and never disappointed
Great part of Aussie History.. It's a must to walk around just for the history. Food and drink prices are pretty steep but it is a tourist hot spot.

Ramble around the rocks. The Rocks is great for a few activities: history (see the free Discovery Museum and walk around the streets), shopping (the markets mostly, not the expensive shops), food (the street markets), and access to the Harbour Bridge and Barangaroo Reserve.
Weekend market. Many local stuffs on display. Reasonable prices. Selection of cafes and restaurants beside the market and good place for chill or rest.

The Rocks ... somewhere to go in the wet. During a wet couple of days in Sydney, we decided to spend some time wandering around The Rocks. There are many wonderful shops and cafes catering to all tastes. Opals, jewellery, Australiana, artworks of many genres, wool products, old and new pubs and restaurants, cheap food, fine dining, it is all there to suit your budget and taste. When wending your way through this, the oldest part of Sydney, there is much history to be gleaned from the many wall plaques detailing Sydney's colourful colonial past. Whether in bright sunshine or a wet and cold day like we had, take some time to discover The Rocks. I am sure you will not be disappointed.

Great place to snoop around. This is the place in Sydney that I've kept returning to. Catch the market if you're able. The Button shop in Nurses Walk is amazing; even if you don't need buttons, it's worth a look!

History that you must see. No visit to Sydney is complete without transporting yoursel back to the earliest days of the colony in Sydney. The Rocks is full of history. It is also full of tourist shops, for that special momento fro Sydney. Every Saturday it hosts an eclectic collection of stalls with many novel and unique gifts at The Rocks Markets. The area is home to a large number of historic pubs where you can relax with a local brew. There are also many good restaurants in the area.A must when in Sydney.
Fabulous. A step back in time. We visited the rocks markets but had a stop for coffee and enjoyed every moment.

So much history in a small place.. The rocks area of Sydney is an institution and a must see for any visitor to Sydney . Great shops, hotels and restaurants. There is a market on weekends and that provides great entertainment for family or singles.
Peaceful on weekday. Old town area which is very busy during the weekend. You may also try to visit during the weekday to enjoy a peaceful walk.

Great area to explore. If you enjoy speciality shopping, eating in a variety of unique places and enjoying stunning back drops then The Rocks area of Sydney is a must. Can be a bit hilly but well worth the effort.

A not so rocky walk. Plenty to do and see here. Many preserved and historical buildings of Victorian era. Easy to walk stroll, stop shop , stop eat, move from building to building shop to shop and all so close to the iconic bridge, opera house and harbour. Beautifully restored area - OK some of the shops are a wee bit touristy but then it is for the tourists, which I was .

Rich history and great Sunday markets. The Rocks is a must for a Sydney visit. It's just a short walk from Circular Quay and at the edge of the harbour. You can go there as a good place to shop. Yes, it is very touristy, but you can find decent prices on all sorts of Australian bits and pieces (e.g. Ugg boots, clothes, Ozzie-style hats, memorabilia, etc.). Also the markets on Sunday have some great niche Australian products. If you go with a local who knows a bit of history you can also learn a lot about Sydney's colonial past. Full of history.

Nice market on weekends. If you go to the rocks on a weekend, it's busy and lively. Heaps of stalls selling crafts & handmade items. The corn stall at the edge of the market is awesome! Butter and chilli! Yum! Lots of cafe and restaurants in the area too.

Busy and lively on weekends. Historically interesting and commercially busy on the weekend when independent sellers set up their wares. During the week, it's quieter and easier to stroll through early Sydney.
Great place to visit. Excellent location and so near to so many other places.. well worth walking around the different bars and food stops

Rich with history.. The Rocks is rich with history and a wonderful place to explore. It's not too built up like the CBD and has retained a lot of it's historical buildings. One place in particular which is worth a visit is the YHA as they have an archaeology education centre, dedicated to preserving artifacts from the Colonial Period through to WWI.There is also a great selection of restaurants and there are some beautiful spots to sit and watch the harbour. In my opinion, it's the best part of Sydney.
Visit the rocks. Lots of food vendors and nice area to walk around. Plenty of small nice restaurants and coffee and desserts. Walking distance to Sydney bridge and harbour.

Thumbs up. . Great for a wander around when the markets are on or if you are in to history etc. In a prime location next to the harbour bridge, circular quay and not far from the opera house. Make sure to call into Harbour View Hotel for a meal and a drink also.
Pioneer history. This is a great place to see some of Australia's oldest establishments - a lot of the early settlers history is still intact - well worth a stroll.
Great Area in Sydney. Staying in the rock during my last visit. Great Area. Lot's of great food and sights. Favorite part of Sydney

Everything expensive not to much things to do better do go local area much better food and cheaper . Better to go local areas much better food and cheaper. Example Darlinghurst, pots point, double bay , rose bay more things to do .

Very nice place to stroll in the afternoon. This is said to be the main to go place in sydney. All friends that are familiar with Sydney always recommend this as a place to go. Nice place for an aftetnoon stroll. A lot of restaurants and shops (but not too much).There is a popular Guylian cafe, that has very very nice selections of chocolate.

Sightseeing and shopping. A lovely area to wander around to see what you can find. Great views over circular quay to the opera house and to the harbour bridge, there are lots of small quirky shops to hunt for souvenirs. We sat on the quay eating lunch and people watching, a great way to spend the day!
Lovely place to visit. A beautiful place to visit. When you are in Sydney, this is the place you should not miss. The market has unique Australian arts and crafts. Interesting food stall too.

Another instagram worthy place. Come here if you would like to visit the market. It has quite a good range of products and F&B. I visited the market in 2012. In my latest trip in May 2016, I visited the area for a stroll only. On weekdays it is rather quiet with some restaurants and museums open. Several "rocks" are up for photos and there is dog statue.
Up scale area just a short walk from Circular Quay. We visited the Rocks area for dinner and shopping. Had a wonderful time in the area and enjoyed the area.
Walk around the Rocks. Markets very nice and lovely variety of stalls. Well presented and clean. Rest of the Rocks area disappointing. Nothing much open or there anymore.

A diverse and amazing experience. There is so much to see and do in The Rocks. As a Sydney sider I have re discovered this very special part of my history while taking overseas visitors on a tour. The weekend markets are a must- so many exquisite handmade treats and delicacies, along with inspiring clothes and handicrafts.
The base. hot seeing the rocks is like not ever been in Sydney so definitely you need to see the market on the street there.
Markets?. The Rocks market on Saturday is a very "up market" affair with lots of lovely stalls with good quality products particularly jewellery. Lovely to walk around even without making a purchase!

Easy ambling taking in the atmosphere . A sunny Saturday morning provided an opportunity for my wife, son and I to wander around and through The Rocks (Talla Wo La Dah). Reaching there at 10am, the street market was in full flow and with a massive cruise ship docked on Circular Quay, it was busy but nevertheless we were able to take in the atmosphere. I guess the USP of The Rocks is the market stalls and these do sell a great variety of items, principally aimed at the tourist market. I confess that we provided them with some business, but for me it's the architecture and history of the place that has real meaning and the reason why it's worth taking the time to visit. There are lots of plaques and information boards that explain the history and social and political significance of The Rocks. I found these fascinating and I began to understand why the area is so important to Sydney. You can't move for places to eat and drink, both stalls and permanent shops, and I'm sure that everyone will be able to find something to their taste. Given it's historical significance a visit to the Rocks should be on every visitor's 'must do' list.

Birth of a nation. The Rocks are not pretty but the have been there for as long as Australia has been settled. Civic do-gooders have been trying to demolish the tumbled-down Rocks for centuries, but the Rocks have survived. Now the authorities have realised that not everyone wants to visit a city that looks as if it was made in Los Angeles, like everywhere else. The Rocks are great for exploration and a great place for a beer.

Great area. If you'll be visiting Sydney, I highly recommend staying in the Rocks area. I stayed here last week for 3 nights, and would love to go back In the future. It's quaint and picturesque, with many cute cafes, restaurants, and shops. There is also a nice market Friday-Sunday. It also abuts Circular Quay, and so provides easy ferry transportation to other areas like Manly Beach and Taronga Zoo.

So interesting!. We were staying at the Shangri La which us very near the Rocks. Our guidebook had a walk around the Rocks area which we followed and it was full of great social history and got me to really see how Sydney first began. The Susannah Place museum is excellent as is the Rocks museum. So worthwhile.
you can go back every day ..... learn about the early settlers and convicts - good experiecnce but also a wonderful place just to be and relaxe - have a good meal and watch people

Historic Area. The Rocks is a historic area near the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Here you will find Quay, the Contemporary a Museum of Art and several boutique hotels, shops, and cafes. There are also frequent street markets here.The Rocks is not as large, nor grand as famous "old towns" in Stockholm or Montreal or areas like The French Quarter in New Orleans.

Great Place. The rocks are a great place for learning a bit of the history of Sydney and Australia. Unfortunately, we visited at a very busy time, the coffee festival. A great view of the Sydney Opera House

Historic area. The rocks is a charming historical area in Sydney that is not to be missed. Take a stroll down this quaint street. There are lots of cute little places to eat, shop, and just browse. There is also a free walking tour every night (pay what you want). In addition there are a couple free museums. ENJOY!

History on the move. This is a brilliant area download the "walk the rocks" app. So much to see and learn. Interlaced with good bar and cafes. Loved the old photos used to give the tourist an idea of how things looked in brgone times. Fron Argyle street steps gp up to cahil expressway and walk across the harbour bridge for unbelievable view of harbour and opera house

Excellent nightlife and atmosphere.. This is another one of those must see places if you are in Sydney. There is a great range of restaurants and too many fantastic good old fashioned pubs to list here so just make sure you visit The Rock's.
nice. nice place to visit, plenty to experience, wear good walking shoes there is heaps to see, recommended
Don't forget to walk the back streets. The Rocks is where it all started. Some of the buildings are amazing. Don't miss the Argyle, the patio is great for a drink
The Rocks. You can get a tour and find out the history of the area. A great walk and it won't cost anything if you just want to stroll around and look on your own. Great waterfront views.

Walk back in time. The Rocks , a place where you step back in time to imagine what our ancestors were dealing with when they arrived here in Sydney in the 1800's.Take an information walk, absorbing as much information on this place as possible!You will never forget it!See the oldest pub, see the oldest piece of road, hear the stories about the dangers of the time long ago!You will return time and time again!

The historic centre of Sydney. I never get sick of wandering around the Rocks, there are great views from all areas plus the nostalgic feeling of walking on old roads, and looking at the old buildings.Not to mention the great cafes and coffee stops

They rock!. The Rocks is a terrific area of Sydney to visit. It's on the opposite side of Circular Quay to the Sydney Opera House, so is easily accessible from hotels in the city. Or stay at one of the hotels in the area. From there, you'll get good views of the Opera House, day or night.It's a very historic area, full of old buildings, but they have, for the most part, been converted to new uses - like restaurants, coffee shops, and trendy stores. There are plenty of pubs too.A great place for a meal or a friendly drink.Many of the cast from 2016 movie, "Star Trek Beyond", were captured having a quiet beer in one of the pubs in The Rocks area when in Sydney for the launch of the movie . I've heard that John Travolta has been known to play pool in one of the pubs there too.So do a little star spotting.Great for a walk around.

Fascinating and beautiful city waterfront walk.. If you can get a tour it's worth it! What a fascinating and styling part of Olde Sydney. Just packed with History, stories of convicts and preachers, protection and the plague. This day and age boutique shopping restaurants galleries answer bars. If you go to Sydney and don't do this.... you haven't really been the Sydney.

Tour The Rocks!. I took a tour with The Rocks Walking Tours, located on Harrington Street, in The Rocks. They were recommended to me by the concierge at the Four Seasons Sydney, and I was very happy with the tour! It was so fascinating!

History alive.. This is "Old Sydney". Well some aspects of the Old city remain, but the whole area is a magnet for locals as well as numerous tourists. All types of unusual shops, including many eateries, cafes, restaurants, and "touristy" establishments, as well as the lovely narrow, old streets and passage ways of "Old Sydney Town". It's all there and it is really great fun. We have been here numerous times and love it each and every time. We have been visiting the Rocks for over forty years and have always enjoyed our time here.

the old Sydney. the rocks are so amazing where modern and old is mixed from glam restaurants to little boutic venue with art galleries and aboriginal art, /the international cruise terminal and its luxury hotels like the Hyatt The Sydney harbour bridge or its new garden Barangaroo.the observatory on the top with most amazing view.the market are not to be missed
Sydney Rocks. Drop into the Museum of Modern Art along the way then take a walk around some of the oldest buildings in Sydney. It's worth popping into some of the old pubs along the way.
Family trip. Too crowded on Sunday to go with the family. I rather go somewhere quieter . The best attraction is of coz the harbour bridge , the rock market and Opera house.
We live here.. Close to everything good ambience nice views.Cruise ships wharf Opera house theatres. Top hotels and eating places. Lived here for 25 years. The only way we are leaving is in a box.

Nice Historical Area to Explore. I went to Sydney for a short girl's trip and we explored the area between a ferry ride and dinner reservations. There were interesting old buildings and it wasn't too far from the Quay. We walked around just to explore so there were no expectations and we enjoyed our time there.
Nice place to hang out. It´s the old part of sydney, but it has a great view of the harbour and fancy plaes to have a date or celebrate an special occasion, with cafes, restaurants and pubs.
Sunset delight . Great place to take interesting photos, have coffee and enjoy a sunset. Relaxed and soothing on waterfront. Definitely worth going for a meal .

Weekend Markets and History. The Rocks is one historical places in Sydney, where one of the first settlers settled. It is a beautiful place for foods, shops and architecture, great place for photography.
On the weekends there are markets and street stalls. Great place for all ages.

Really cool area and great views!. This is a really cool area, sort of has a bohemian vibe to it. Lots of bars and restaurants all close together, some have live music on. You are right next to the harbour as well and get a great view of the opera house. You might pay a little more in some of these bars but due to the location right underneath the bridge its worth it. Mostly for tourists I would say but definitely worth a visit.

Join a tour to see 'the Real Rocks'. On a tour you get to find out the true history of the rocks. Plenty of alleys to get lost in! Old pubs to have a drink and see live music at night and markets each weekend.

Lovely place to get a real feel of the "old town". So much history in The Rocks, from the museums to the buildings to the landmarks.Walking through it all is easy and very enjoyable for anyone & is very accessible. You will find great places for a pint and some eats everywhere!

its a great place to walk around for teh history of the old buildings. need to do the markets they are great lots of Australian products to buy to take or send home ,and to be able to see the ould buildings and see the harbour as well .
Explore the old parts of Sydney. Lovely area where Sydney was first built. Old streets and buildings and a fair amount of tourist shops. Lots of restaurants
Overrated and expensive.. More of the Rocks seems to be modernised but empty, since my previous visit many years ago. There is little atmosphere left of the area that once was.

Aroma Coffee Festival July 2016. 19th Annual Aroma Festival outstanding for stalls, fun and festivities. Great day out despite the chill. Over 200 stalls of coffee, tea, sweets, treats and devices with plenty of music and demonstrations. (Honestly, how much coffee can one person sample? I had to stop at 3 to avoid overload!) Fun day!

History Lesson but Fun. What a beautiful place. Great entertainment from buskers and the didgeridoo players bring in the true Aussie ambiance. Awesome and interesting shops to visit and the architecture of some of the buildings is amazing. Saw the most priceless 'fairy sandwich' in a shop window but got told off by the owner for taking a photo of it and not buying it - LOL, fair enough. Definitely worth the visit and we walked back to Darling Habour loving every step of the trip.

Great small neighborhood in the heart of Sydney...... near the waterfront and close to the Harbor cruises and the Sydney Opera House. Nice to stroll through, with many places to eat and fun shops. Was lucky to catch a weekend street market with lots of interesting food from nearby restaurants and fun trinkets, souvenirs and Australian crafts. A must if you are visit this lovely city!
Quaint. The Rocks is a very nice Sydney neighborhood. There are all sorts of shops and restaurants. There even weekend markets that are in this area on occasion. Do not miss this area.
Sunday Markets are a must for all visitors to Sydney. Such unique markets... Something for everyone. Not junks great fi is can be found and the Rocks is an amazing history filled area.

Don't miss...history and eating!. So many areas in the rocks to enjoy. Suzanne's house is a wonderful part of Sydney history...there are so many eating places you could not do them justice in a month. It is a joy to simply walk through the place...loved it.

Must-see attraction when in Sydney. Plenty to do and see at the Rocks: check out the museum of contemporary art, one of the oldest Sydney pubs, shopping, Pancake on the rocks, etc. If you're on a budget, staying at the YHA there might be a steal, given that it has a 5-star view (I'm saying this with reference to the same kinda view you get at the 5-star hotels from the vicinity). Enough said, check it out!
Beautiful. A great escape from Sydney new. Love the shops and eateries/pubs. So much history and so tastefully maintained.

Worth a walk around. Nothing really special about the Rocks, it's okay but touristy and therefore expensive. Have a walk around which costs nothing we did find a nice bar for a drink, but the restaurants are very expensive even for basic grub.
Enjoyed the pancakes!. Pancakes on The Rocks is a popular restaurant which was recommended by a friend. Our family went back to this place 2 or 3 times. It was fun and different!

Back to the past. Location is near others sydney attraction, located in sydney cbd so you can not just pass this object. The walk may be tiring because there were a lot of stairs but once you reach this place you will feel flashback to 20 or 30 years ago. Good ambience and good spot for taking pictures.
Cool. This is the happening, tourist area of Sydney. There are historic places as well as trendy bars and great views. I'm staying here and it's nice to walk outside and have a ton of things to do.
Leaisure Trip. Close to circular quay and International Terminal. Really nice place to enjoy a day shopping and eating

History at a glance.. Explore and get yourself lost in the historical Rocks area. Many interesting shops and street stalls abound for the inquiring traveller or day visitor. The pubs are also great for a quick ale or wine!
Beautiful secrets. You can't best the character of The Rocks area, a few steps from the bustling downtown and harbour you enter another olde world of secrets and discoveries.

Great "boiling pot" of humanity.. I loved walking through The Rocks area of Sydney, the market that wandered through the streets and a wonderful German bierstube where we listened to live musicians while we partook of their wonderful food and beer.

The Rocks ... fascinating. Sydney's Rocks area has so much to commend it ... Sydney's early history, the buildings, the atmosphere ... it is a "world apart". And all of this is right alongside the harbour at Circular Quay. There are many great places to eat, with an abundance of variety both in cuisines and prices. Walk along the cobblestoned streets, past many craft shops, and then around Circular Quay to the Opera House. You can't get lost, except in time!

A great place to visit. My husband and I visited the Rocks area one Sunday recently.... what a lovely place to visit... plenty of eateries, many of which looked absolutely divine. The Rocks markets are held on a Sunday Morning with lots of interesting stalls and bargains to be had. A great atmosphere and easy to get around.... lots of interesting heritage areas to explore... lots of history... we will return!

The Rocks, Rock!. The Rocks is an eclectic mix of culture, art, food, drinks, and awesome views right in the center of Sydney. If you haven't been here, you haven't been to Sydney! Right behind circular quay, you cant miss it. (look out for regular public events taking place here!)
Beautiful Area near the cruiseships. This is a great place to eat and shop. It is next to the cruise ships so you can have a drink and watch the ships arrive and depart.

An interesting piece of Australia's not just Sydney's history. I have walked all over the rocks had meals, drinks and coffees over many years. More recently I went with my children schools as a parent helper and did some of the tours. Very educational and I recommend even locals do them.

Historic walk and open air market on weekend. We took a stroll to the Rocks to visit the market on Sat. Atmosphere is great as there is plenty of shops to browse through, offering local artists work and produce like chocolates and pastries. Have a coffee at the street cafe and enjoy the music from the street musician. Try to go in the morning around 10am to 11am when most of the shops are up and the aroma of the food and coffee is in the air.
So many hidden treasures. The family and I walked around the rocks all day and night. there was so much to see and around every corner was another surprise. So much history and a great feel.

Great food and views. I have visited the rocks on many occasions and enjoy it ever time. You can walk around and find some new like shop, café, bar or view point each time. Great little café severing scones and tea at the back of the Irish Shop. The view from the Glenmore Hotel roof bar is beautiful and one of the best around.

Historic area. The Rocks is one of my favorite areas of Sydney. I love the history of the area and the restaurants. I like just wandering around the area visiting restaurants and shops. This area is like a little escape from the busy Harbour area and the very busy business area.

Love this place. The rocks is a great place to stroll around so much to do and see. Lots of restaurants and shops to go to also. We went to outdoor market that had wonderful treasures to buy. Ate at the Pancake house. Strolled along the harbour and took ferry boat out to see the zoo and different harbours from Sydney. Also was able to catch the hop on hop off his to take a tour around Sydney. Very centrally located to do things plus see the Sydney bridge and botanical garden
Love The Rocks. Fabulous place to visit, walk about, watch the people and enjoy a coffee or food item.Even better on a beautiful, sunny winter's day.
Bustling . Very lively at night packed full of history and close to everything. A good place to stay in if you don't mind it being a bit noisy.

Great spot close to the waterfront to visit. If you have a bit of time to spare make sure you wander through the Rocks area of the city , plenty of history to soak up and lots of food and shops , interesting markets on the weekend Don't miss spirit gallery if you are looking for indigenous art

Great history. Learning about this area was really interesting. We walked around a lot and the views are amazing. There are so many amazing restaurants and bars that give you an awesome view of the city and the bridge. A trip wouldn't be complete without this.
Great market. Awesome markets, with different crafts, art, foods! And good coffee, highly recommend it if you're around the area
Great Location. Lots of great bars and restaurants for eating and drinking in a great location with wonderful scenery to look at.

Sunday Adventure. Rather than spending Sunday at home... Jump on a train to Circulat Quay and go to The Rocks markets. The Rocks is jam packed with history, interesting things to see and yummy food to eat!

Heart and Soul of Sydney. We spent a few days walking around the Rocks and discovering the original Sydney. The experience is enhanced by taking the walking tours that are offered. Although "old" buildings mean only 1850's era you still get a deep appreciation and better understanding for colonial life by walking around the Rocks. The area is dotted with cafe style restaurants and interesting unique shops. It is connected to Circular Quay and is in the middle of everywhere most tourists want to be when visiting town.
Great atmosphere and fun to check out the sights and sounds and food!. Nice area to walk around and shop, enjoy the flea market atmosphere, enjoy the food and the music!A great place!

Plenty to see and do. The Rocks area of Sydney is a fascinating place to wander and absorb the sights and sounds of old Sydney town. There are plenty of museums to wander around in and lots of curio shops with plenty to see and do. Be wary that many of the shops are exclusive and quite expensive but you can wander and window shop without being hassled by any sales people. Wander up and under the Sydney Harbour bridge by following George Street along and visit the pubs in the local area or just take great photographic views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House across the water of circular quay.We had ice cream while we wander and the ice cream shop at the Rocks has none to equal it in Sydney. Make sure you give yourself a couple of hours to wander and absorb this great area of Sydney close to Circular Quay.

Best of Sydney. Sydney is all about the Harbor and the beautiful water. The Rocks is the oldest part of town and right on the harbor. The Rocks is quaint and has a European flavor, which is hard to find in a relatively young country. Lots of small streets lined with shops and restaurants. This is where you want to be if visiting Sydney. The rest is essentially a big downtown business district.

Love the rocks. The markets at the rocks are fantastic. Lots of local designers. When in Sydney, I always wander up to the rocks for these markets. There are lots of resteraunts to grab a bite. Close to circular quay and darling harbour.
My favorite spot in Sydney.. A great place to hang out anytime. The weekend markets are so vibrant and lively. Also a great place for shopping.

When in Sydney, visit The Rocks.. When in Sydney, visit The Rocks. Casual shopping at the Sunday market, delectable grub from the many eateries, great coffee and the Sydney Visitor Information Centre. Absolute must to kickstart any Sydney trip.

Sunday Arvo. Always nice to have a walk around the Rocks. Very historical area with some quality restaurants and pubs. Gets quite crowded on the weekends. Markets are interesting. Great views of the harbour , the bridge and the opera house.

Cute and Relaxed . The Rocks is such a lovely place that everyone should visit when traveling to Sydney. It carries plenty of variety so that everyone can fully enjoy. You can find lots of unique trinkets and such here. Also carries a variety of restaurants and food stands too. Everyone had smiles on their faces, and seemed to enjoy it as much as we did! Very relaxed environment and a nice place to unwind and look around after being surrounded in huge crowds in the more outer/popular parts of the city.

Great views of the Harbor and perfect for strolling, browsing and eating. Visitors to Sydney should spend time browsing around this historic area of the harbour area. There has been a lot of restoration and the area is full of cultural resources, museums and theatres. Its also dotted with good bars and restaurants. There are lots of great walks and we recommend a nice stiff walk alongside the water from the Sydney Theatre Company's main venue and ending at Circular Quay.

A Sydney must do . One can just spend hours and hours wandering around the area there is just to much to see and do , and what with all the little watering holes a beer is never far away . Ones favourite area of Sydney , please make time as you will not be disappointed .

Lovely Place. This is a really nice area. When we went there on a Sunday they had a market which sold nearly everything. The observatory is worth a visit. Nice pubs and restaurants. You can also do the Bridge walk from there as well.Great place.

A phtographer's dream location. If you love taking pictures, and are serious about it (well, pretty serious) you have to get up pre dawn, unload the tripod, and settle yourself in on the foreshore, at The Rocks. The dawn from here is stunning - the sun rises behind the Opera House and kicks off the windows - voila! Cover shot. Also, the streets in The Rocks are pretty deserted early n, and offer some great options for creative work.

A trend . Maybe in missing something- but this was a disappointment. Had long walk with high expectations and found it hard to find somewhere decent to eat. Finally chose Munich place which was good but the rocks itself was pretty deserted and signposting not very helpful! Tried again to see what all the fuss was about today but again.... I think it's just a seen to have been place....

Nice restaurants and views of Sydney Opera House. Great experience to dine here, while enjoying the scenic view of the Sydney Opera House. Great food and wine here, and after dinner, we walked around this area and admiring the beauty of the sea and Opera House

Sydney meets Europe. Our Hotel was by the Rocks and it was such a quaint little area. Although it is not necessarily a big area, it was very unique from what I thought was Australia.There are a few french bakeries and some duty free shops for brand name accessories and fashions (never went in).On Friday's, there's a small little outdoor market that has various vendors selling various types of things and foods. Wish I had a chance to sample them, they looked delectable!

Old history and modern culture. This place really sets you away from the traffic, noise and big city pace. Here you have museums, shops and café's and lots of old scenery to enjoy. Read a little before you come here, and your visit will be even more interesting. Enjoy!
Very few to see.. We walked from our hotel to the Rocks, it was a decent experience, not many things to see; cafes, old buildings preserved to its current state, etc.

Shopping & history in one go. Great place to shop on market days - really excellent selection of goods for sale - presents or keep it for yourself. Lots of restaurants, lots of things to see. Art Gallery, historic buildings, views of the harbour. Wander around, imagine Sydney as it was 200 years ago...
History AND Shopping. Great shopping in the historic district of The Rocks. Good eating and pubs. Gorgeous cottages and town houses. Walk or take the Hop on Hop off Bus around Sydney.

Australia with kids. It's a cozy little area with nice shops and Restaurants. Besides good ice cream, not much to do for kids. For sightseeing: it's ok but really not much more than that if you're from a country with a history that goes further back than 200 years. Australia has a lot of interesting heritage but not after the 1st fleet arrived.

Go on the weekend. Yes, this is a place for tourists to go but there are plenty of locals there too. Go on a weekend when they have the market stalls up and running. There is a ton to see and do, buy and eat while you are there. Great way to spend a weekend morning or afternoon.
We loved the Rocks. Nestled on the west side of Circular Quay the Rocks offers a wonderful variety of cafes, shops, and outdoor market, museums and views of the Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour.

Walk through history. The Rocks is a very historical area where one can see some of the first buildings associated with the early colony. There are also many restaurants, shops and terrific pubs. It is accessible by all. On weekends there is a market displaying quality goods for sale. The Rocks are offers great views of the Harbour, Opera House , Harbour Bridge and ferry terminal. Huge ships are sometimes docked at the Overseas Terminal. Parking is limited, so better to take the rain in to Circular Quay. There is also easy access to the new Barangaroo area a short walk away. The Rocks is a must visit for tourists to Sydney.

A Must-see. The Rocks area contains so much history you get the feeling you could step around any corner and be thrust back in time. The original steps, buildings etc and the accompanying signage are a fascinating insight into Sydney in the early days. It is also surprisingly safe, even on New Years Eve. The Rocks Markets are a must see as is the Mercantile Hotel (Australia's oldest Irish pub) on a Friday or Saturday night or just for a hearty meal.

Lovely old area. Apart from stacks of history this area is also full, of art, great bars and restaurants. Take the extra time to go round to Millers Point and observe the battle underway to retain this heritage area.

Great place to meander around. The Rocks area is a great place to meander around – it is full of history and old buildings. There's a Rocks Discovery Museum and also walking tours available.Very convenient to the city and Circular Quay and it’s a great place to take beaut photos of the Sydney Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay and the city skyline.
Hipsters part of the town…. it is the hipster part of the town, i enjoyed walking there and having lunch here, doing some shopping, 3 hours are enough

Do your self a favour. At each opportunity to visit Sydney The Rocks area is always on our itinerary. From great eateries and bars to the weekend markets there is something for everyone here. A large range of items at the markets to suit all tastes and styles. Plenty of opportunity for great coffee and live entertainment at the markets that is first class - as the old saying goes ... do your self a favour and do not miss the opportunity to enjoy this great part of Sydney.

Great place to chill out and see the views . Checked this area out both during the day and also at night. Great place. There is a market on Saturdays and Sundays also.Many restaurants and bars here as well.

The rocks. What a quaint spot to visit. Mostly pedestrian zone with tonnes of little gem restaurants tucked into the little streets. Wonderful to stroll along the streets to view the very old original houses of the first inhabitants of Australia. Definitely worth a visit.

Visit the heart of Old Sydney - don't forget the market on Sat./Sun.. This is a must-see for history buffs. a lovely stroll away from the bustle. great for shoppers or those who want to stop for a nosh and people watch.

A Fantastic Experience. I love The Rocks area, the history, cafes, restaurants and the wonderful Rocks Market.I never tire of visiting this area of Sydney. It is easily accessible by train, ferry and bus and is right next to the bridge, opera house and Circular Quay. If visiting try and do a ghost tour or a free Rocks tour which your accommodation provider should be able to help with. There are so many hidden gems that you really cant explore properly on your own.

Lovely area. This is a lovely area of Sydney near the harbour bridge. The oldest pub and lots of small shops are here too there is a lovely cake shop near the oldest pub that has wonderful cakes you see everyone standing looking in the window drooling !!! There are quite a few nice places to eat too and the rocks market is well worth a visit if I remember correctly it's on at the weekend so we missed it this visit much to my disappointment as there are some great things to buy here that are that wee bit different to what we can get at home and at Christmas they have unusual ornaments
The heritage. of Australia. So much to see and do. The architecture of Old Sydney is on display. Fantastic eateries and great pubs for lunch or a quiet little drink. The history is well worth it.

lots of great shops and restaurants . whether you are staying nearby or not, this is a lovely area to visit shop or dine with views of the bridge and opera house. the steeper inclines are somewhat avoidable but good exercise if you like. stop in the all marked visitor center for lots of info.
Really worth the visit.. The Rocks area is fascinating. We can really recommend a walking tour around the Rocks. The history, the way people lived, the tour was very informative, loved it.

Sydney sites. Great area of town to explore. Fun restaurants and great shopping. Interesting and unique shops - a honey shop, art galleries, soap store and more. On certain days there is an outdoor market, this is definitely an area worth exploring.
great neighborhood. very charming with lots of old restored buildings at the foot of the bridge. so much more charm than the downtown hotels.
Sydney on the Rocks. The atmosphere here is amazing. You just sit here and drink it all in. There are great views from here. You can hop on a ferry and travel to other places.

Amazing place. This is the place you imagine when people talk about Sydney. You can catch the different boats from here to go places such as Taronga Zoo. There are all the different coffee shops and food places around here available for Lunch and Dinner. A must do if you are visiting Sydney.

Breakfast in the Rocks. Fantastic breakfast with great big flavor some mushrooms
At Danieli was the best breakfast we had traveling all around Australia

Nice views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We went for a long walk from Chinatown to Circular Quay, round to The Rocks and around Sydney Harbour until we eventually got to Darling Harbour. The views from The Rocks to the Sydney Opera House as the sun set were beautiful and we took many nice pics. The walk onwards under the Sydney Harbour Bridge also resulted in many great photos, especially as it was all lit up for the night.
Old Sydney. See where the first European settlers came ashore in Sydney to start a new life (or a life sentence in some cases).

Great place to spend the day. Every Friday is market day 10am-4pm. Market is mainly food stalls. Not a lot of stalls though. Many interesting shops to browse around. From designer to gallery. Excellent views of Sydney harbour bridge and Opera house. 5 mins walk from Circular quay. Must stop at modern contemporary art museum for a coffee on 4th floor with rooftop view and free wifi.
Best place to stay around Sydney. Old world architecture meets busy new world technology and bustling vibrant harbour area. Great shops, eateries, pubs, and people watching. Good walking everywhere.

The first fleet, and the history. One of the historical places to visit in Sydney and one of the lively places to be over the weekend. Do not forget to see the old hospital and the actual rocks behind the old houses (now shops).Walk from circular quays and look at the old wooden road bricks on top of George street.You could also have amazing views of opera house and harbour bridge from the viewing point next to the rocks, downstairs.

Stroll through Sydney's historical heart. It is always nice to have a stroll through the Rocks are of Sydney. The area a great for walking but be aware there are lots of steps and steep roads. Lots of the older buildings have been brought back to life as pubs or restaurants. As you wander you can catch glimpses of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from angles not often seen. Highly recommended.

Picturesque. The Rocks is very beautiful. There are quite a few things to do there but it may seem overwhelming if you're new to the area. I would recommend doing a walking tour of The Rocks before deciding what to do. There are already a few walking tours listed on TripAdvisor, so you can start there. The walking tour I did was with Gray Line Sydney -- it was thorough yet not too boring and included everything.
History, atmosphere. great place something different from the rest of the city, historic places and quaint cafes, great pubs. you cant come to Sydney and miss this place

Great way to spend an afternoon. The Rocks is a very quaint and charming area. On the weekend, they have a market that adds to the charm and shopping options. Set alongside the harbor, The Rocks offers history, shopping, food and beverage.

Great to visit on a weekend BUT....... just be aware that prices are very high (typical tourist trap). Nice stalls with hand made goodies. Restaurants for every taste and every wallet.Even when it rains , it is nice to walk around.

Good for those who like a bit of history. Walking around the Rocks is best done in the evenings when it is not so hot. This part of Sydney has some character, seeing it is one of the earlier settlements. There are plenty of alleys and pathways between the buildings for your to negotiate. Sometimes you can get a little lost. If you do not wish to explore this area on your own, there are free walking tours you can join.
Great place to meander. The old town and a really nice place to chill and walk around. Market on a sunday is worth visiting. Plenty of places to eat and drink.
Walk. What a great place to walk around there is a lot of food and snack places plus a few places to have a cold drink on a hot day.
History. You can see original buildings from our convict days, visit the museum, walk the alleys and Fri/Sat enjoy the street markets.

Historic Area. Any visit to Sydney should certainly include a trip to the Rocks area. Whilst some of it is very touristy there are quieter areas that retain the old pubs and cottages. Be prepared to climb up and down steep stairs or hills. Guided walking tours are available. Weekend market selling mainly hand crafted goods & Friday food market. Remember the area was mainly hand cut out of the steep cliffs by the earliest white inhabitants, many convicts. Lots of cafes & restaurants though I'd advise sterling clear of the very touristy ones on the main streets. A very good Tourist Information Centre provides lots of information on all Sydney has to offer & can book tours too.

Walk around the history of Sydney. The Rocks are what Sydney was like back in the 1800's. Amazing little alley ways, steep steps, gorgeous old pubs which retain their history. Old houses line Kent Street and retain the atmosphere of the times. On the weekend the Rocks Market is a must to visit. Following the natural flow of the harbour with water views as you walk.

The Rocks - Great historical place to spend part of your vacation. It`s wonderful, you will find your place of interest to visit thru Rocks, also Sydney as a city offers a lot of historical points of interest, shopping in modern shops and taking you back in time old pubs, visit one of kind opera house, cruise in Sydney harbor on ferry. The walks in Rocks and Botanical garden it`s something you will not forget.

Had a tour..... It was great . Rich in history..... Narrow walks, old buildings and structures..... Good they were preserved.... Booked through greyline tours.... Had city tour with stephen who was funny and humorous..... Then hus partner i forgot the name did the tour of some parts of the ricks and olden day stories
Australias colonial history. Had a great rocks tour. So much to see and so many stories. Loved it. Good tour for all ages. (watch the coblestones). Many lovely places to shop also

A walk back in time. Love the Rocks area of Sydney. Lots of local history, and plenty of cafe's and restaurants, where you can enjoy a relaxing afternoon. A walk along the waterfront by the old Maritime services building watching the ferries come and go. The time gets away from you. Have a beer at the The lord Nelson There is a good variety of boutique beers.

Historic and great spot to view the Opera House. It's like a step back in time. The Rocks is wonderful for history lovers. Take a free walking tour from the city, which typically ends at The Rocks. This was also my favorite spot to view the Opera House. There's a circular staircase that takes you up to a viewing deck. It's a great spot for photographing the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House.

A nice historical spot. It is not just a place filled with shops and restaurants but buildings that are old and historical. It is a nice and chilled place. A must and of course don't forget Pancakes by the rocks!

I love The Rocks!!. Whether you just amble through the streets enjoying the views of our beautiful harbour, sit in one of several pubs for a drink, relax in a café for a meal or visit the markets, you will have a wonderful day. You can be as busy or as relaxed as you want. I simply love the vibe of The Rocks!

Go during the day when the market vendors are out!. I found the Rocks to be quite bland in the evening after the street vendors had packed up and gone home. I much more enjoyed wandering about when the food and shop sellers were out during the day.

Great Market on weekend . Found this market last weekend. Was very impressed with the quality of the stalls and the goods on offer. Not junky like a lot of the others. A lot of hand crafted Australian products. My wife was very impressed with the baby clothes

Interesting artistic and historic discoveries to be made.. We enjoyed walking around the Rocks district. We went after breakfast on a public holiday. We visited a little museum where we learnt some of the history of the area and saw a beautiful photography/ poetry exhibition. We discovered quirky laneways and interesting art. We met a lady walking her dogs who was very informative and friendly. We had fun taking photos.We were not there to shop although there are plenty of interesting shops catering to cruise ships and tourists generally. Unfortunately we didn't try any of the eateries we came across. Many looked like they were busy and overflowing with sounds of happy people.

Can't go Rong at the Rocks. If you love life and variety mixed with a little chaos, you will love the Rocks. I have been there 4 different times and always find it to be exciting and full of surprises. Restaurants, with hidden outdoor patios, bathrooms in old jail cells, food of every culture imaginable, bars, music, markets, cool jewelry stores, gyms, soccer fields, and the Rocks Museum will beckon. Each is a must see and you will be rewarded by the experience.Spend the day and be sure to hit market days.

a great area to explore building build by convict 18th centruy it has german Lowenbrau restaurant a flea market every Su. german Loewenbrau Restaurant german food and beer I would recommend and some buildings are build in the 18th century by british convicts has a market on weekends and is also cruise harbour
Touristic. Not as it used to be, years ago it was full of Old Sydney character but now its just tourist shops an over priced opal, jewellery shops and food shops.
History and fun. The Rocks is a lovely place to enjoy early Sydney architecture. Has wonderful pubs and restaurants. Great Markets on Sunday.

Lovely Old Area. We have been here many, many times over the years and never tire of the beautiful old buildings. It's just a lovely place to meander around, plenty of places for 'sustenance' along the way...we love it!
lovely historical area. Great on weekends for the markets and old pubs and restaurants. Quite touristy but if in Sydney a must visit

a look at history. in the rocks precinct you get to have a look at the beginnings of Australian heritage and lots more, the rocks markets on the weekend are well worth the visit or just sit in one of the quaint pubs for a nice quiet drink, pub food aplenty lots of atmosphere more the rocks markets on the weekend are well worth the visit
The Rocks. Near Opera House but need to find way through little streets. Easy to get to from George street. Disappointed with weekend market, not many stalls but it was raining that day

Learn Sydney's Convict hustory. Lots of great bars, restaurants and shopping. Weekends they have a fantastic street market with great food options and tables to sit and enjoy your meal. Take a walking tour to get the most out of your visit.

Fantastic walking. Nothing but the best in terms of people watching, ferry action and street entertainment. One can easily spend an afternoon enjoying the sites and the wonderful food, drinks in the area.

Nice . Loved the closeness of the Rocks to the Hotel we stayed at . Some lovely shops on the rocks and also some lovely restaurant's . Would have loved to have spent more time on the Rocks but only had 4 days in Sydney
The Rocks . Fusion of Culture. Very nice place to cool off. Nice ambience, Nice food. In Sydney , Most attractions are easily accessible, and their tranport Network is very good

Very nice area and great Saturday markets . I always love to visit The Rocks and the markets. And they also have very nice café around the area. I tried the Japanese food stall in the market, I was very disappointed, wish I went to a cafe instead. However the market stalls were interesting, always find new things there each time I visit Sydney.

Nice place. Nothing special , walked about 2 hours there .There are some people taking wedding pictures, some tourists with there tour leader.I was trying to reach The Rocks Square thinking that this is a center of this attraction ,however there is no center for this attraction .At the end i went for a drink on Munich at the Rocks Square.Visited on the 20th of May.
A must see. The rocks is a great place to visit , great pubs and restaurants and the best markets on Sunday's , a definite must

Awesome place . Fair buzzing on a sunny winters day - great to see the waterfront utilized by family groups etc.... would recommend a tour of the opera house and a stop at Sydney oldest pup !!! Great atmosphere and a chance to talk with locals - brilliant Aussie's are very friendly people and great ambassadors for thier lucky country - highly recommended
Great historical area. Very well maintained with free museums and walking paths. I enjoyed the bike ride groups. Wonderful way to see the harbor area.,
Rocks Market. Nice area to stroll around, make sure you go when the Market is on. Nice boutique stalls, not only the standard overpriced souvenirs and great street food

Feel the History. The Rocks is a place full of Australian History (mostly from the British perspective - although there is a great indigenous centre too). Walk around, read the plaques and reminisce about what Sydney would have been like in the days gone by. If you are in town for the weekend you also get to enjoy the street markets.

Great architecture and ambience. Went to The a Rocks on a Sunday when the markets were on. It was busy but not over-crowded, possibly as I went early. The markets have a mix of cheap trinkets and some good designer items. Definitely worth a trip.

The Rocks. Lovely area of Sydney and one of the oldest. Just walk around the narrow streets and alleyways taking in the historic atmosphere. There's a small market definitely Friday but maybe Saturday also. Food is available from the market and there are a number of interesting restaurants. Certainly worth a couple of hours of your time here.

Interesting history and souvenirs. This is for the rocks where sydney was first settled it still has all the old sandstone is full of history and the old convict ‘ghosts’. Great market and we bought a lot of interesting souvenirs to bring back to our friends and relatives.

Great place to stay!. My husband and I are in the middle of our stay at Sydney Harbour YHA located in The Rocks District. The Rocks is a fantastic place to stay, as it is walking distance from Sydney Harbour, lots of restaurants and bars, and has great history surrounding it. Highly recommend staying in this area when in Sydney!

Nooks and crannies. The rocks are the oldest part of Sydney and are packed with lots of neat little shops, pubs and restaurants. They are bit of a tourist hangout so can be overpriced, but they ooze character and are definitely worth wandering around...

History awaits. Best examples of Sydney's earliest white settlement. Beautiful sandstone buildings and cobble stoned laneways. Plenty of great accommodation options allowing easy access to local sights, museums, cafes and restaurants. Shopping is popular among the tourists and the weekend markets are a must do. This is an iconic area of Sydney and a must see for all tourists.

Very tourist friendly. Interesting history, if you do the walking tour, Danica gives great historic tips.
Lovely at night was well, full of restaurants to eat and drink in.
A lot ofm uphill walking, though.
Fun end of town. Arty, historic by Aussie standards and just fun to walk around. Perhaps a bit hyped beyond what it actually is, but hey, that true of the trendy end of most cities.

Nice small Historic Lanes. We actually did not plan to go there but walked into some of the back lanes where Sydney was first established. Very nice and peaceful. We were lucky that there were not too many tourist in the are towards late evening.

Take a walk around The HIstoric Rocks. Any time I get to Sydney I love to take a walk around The Rocks. It has a feeling of early Australia with a modern twist. Walk to the end of the Wharf past the Australian Dance Company and lunch at a lovely relaxed restaurant or pick one of the cafe's that ooze atmosphere.

History plus!. It's always nice to get out and about in The Rocks. It is steeped in history and I love all the little lanes and nooks and crannies everywhere. And the views of the harbour are magnificent. You could spend hours wandering around so make time for this gem.
Markets. Night markets . corn on a stick was so good corn and a can of drink for $5 can't beat those prices and all the night life around the street food and stalls made a good night out

Interesting area.. We walked around the area which had lots of History, shops with many old and new things to purchase. Mostly flat with some inclines and steps. Many Restaurants to eat at, some more expensive than others but most have a menu out the front which include the prices.

Lovely neighborhood, just off the Harbour. Make sure to add the Rocks to your Sydney visit. This quaint area has a wonderful craft market with hundreds of vendors. There are many places to sit, have a drink or snack and just enjoy the ambiance of this neighborhood

A delightful walk full of history and ambience. Enjoyed the Saturday markets, the historic buildings, Campbell's Cove, the monuments and just the general feel of the place. A good place to escape the hype.

Nice place to chill during the weekend. Go during the weekend when the market is in operation. A nice place for the entire family to walk around. Being just beside Circular Quay, you can visit The Rocks together with a ferry trip to Manly or the likes. When at The Rocks, do also make a trip to Pancakes on the Rocks for some amazing pancakes. As the weekend market is only in operation during the day, my recommendation is to visit The Rocks in the daytime.
Lots of pubs for a drink. We went out to the rocks for a night out, lots of verity for do on and drink and great views of the bridge.Definitely the area to visit if you want a night out!
Stunning place to visit. Beautiful place to ramble, very historic .. Market at the weekend is with a visits, lots of places to ear and drink and some very old pubs to visit...

Gorgeous. Went on a ghost tour around the rocks. Loved all the old laneways and buildings. Didn't know they were there. The atmosphere was buzzing with people enjoying the vivid light show and it was lovely walking around the markets.
Beautifully located and presented.. These sandstone buildings, penal architecture are Beautifully located and presented, with loads to do on a weekend with markets and festival atmosphere.

Simply Stunning. probably one of the best spots to stay easy access to all transport and activities get any where fairly quickly walking distance to CBD very vibrant. Don't miss the markets heaps top look at and bargains to be had just enjoy

Beautiful place with Saturday market. This is a beautiful historic part full of cafes and restaurants. Don't miss Saturday markets, they are very colorful and nice. You can buy beautiful original gifts there.
always worth a walk thru. the area is compact and easily accsessed shopping,food and old style pubs markets on the weekend as far as i know only visited on weekend

Great space with lots of history.. This was our first extended visit to Sydney and loved visiting The Rocks. There is colonial history every where.
The little laneways and nooks and cranies were enhanced by the drizzle which made the qhole experience fantastic.
The Rocks discovery museum was free and worth a look. It's fairly small so you dont need heaps of time.

Old Sydney. The Rocks is another Sydney icon that has actually I believe has got better with age with its proximity to new and inviting fun family activities. There are things for the old, party goers & families all feel safe due to lighting and police around the area.A place worth adding to your agenda !!

Great weekend markets. Within walking distance from the harbour. Great historic area with amazing shopping and cafes. On weekends, there is a great market area with lots of options for locals and visitors.
Worth a visit. The rocks area is defineately worth a visit. When we visited there was a large street market selling hand crafted items and some great food stalls

Stunning visit to the Rocks. A highly recommended location for both locals and visitors, to experience the rich heritage of our convict past coupled with stunning views of both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Plenty of good shopping, food outlets and historic pubs.
quaint place. had real character plenty of shops to browse quite a few eating and drinking places depending on what you are looking for
The heart of sydney. Dont miss this, try to go on a walking tour if you can. Great history and atmosphere. Try the lord Neilson or hero of Waterloo fior a drink

Perfect for foodies. Great area with lots of shops and restaurants, everyone who wants to see and be seen is in this area. Easy to access and close to all the Sydney attractions, lots of excellent heritage buildings and markets, check out the Sunday Market as they have everything in there you could ever want. We were through the Rocks a number of times recently as our hotel was nearby and we met friends a number of evenings in the area at various restaurants and bars. Very lively area, lots to see and do for everyone.

Lovely market on Sundays. At the other end of the Sydney Harbour Bridge is the Rocks, a quaint village. I was lucky to be there on Sunday when they have the local market. You can find everything here from food stalls to dress shops (both new and second hand ones), great music bands and toys. Everyone is friendly so even if you came by train and the station us next door, you get into the wonderful work of the Rocks!
