I would also recommend the evening Ghost tour which is interesting!

Transports you back in time. Great area for walking around and poking your nose down every alley and into every street. Lots of plaques to give you an insight of how life was in this area 100 years ago.
Great!. This was a wonderful walk, steeped in history and beautiful old architecture. We visited the oldest bar in Australia which wasn't busy at that time, and enjoyed it very much.

Ideal little location in Sydney. Loved the old Sydney feel to it. While there is some touristy stuff there, it's also got the old town feel to it compared to the rest of high rise Sydney with it's modern look. Every time I come to Sydney, I always make my way to the Rocks for a weekend to unwind, visit some nice restaurants, and stroll through the Rocks Market for souvenirs.
The Rocks. I forget what exactly this is, but it was good. The bus tour went to a lot of places and homes. Homes were expensive even though they may not have looked expensive

Love the Rocks. Love the markets and the village atmosphere. great place to get a feed and just relax over a drink or two. The markets on a Sunday were good value, but marketed for the tourist which is OK.

Not as good as years ago - preferred St Kilda market. We left buying some goods until the Rocks in Sydney and wished we had bought at St Kilda market when we were in Melbourne. Much greater variety and interesting local products there.It was still worn a visit but we were a little disappointed

Very nice on a Sunday morning. This is a lovely destination if you're on a cruise ship moored at Circular Quay or if you're staying in the CBD. There are lovely old buildings restored with cafes and specialty shops and on Saturday and Sunday, there are very good markets. Excellent for a casual stroll.

Old and new in one place. We walked around The Rocks looking at the old buildings as well as the new. One could rush a visit through this area and not take in all there is to see. It is amazing how people built the original houses right up close to the rock faces. If you like cafes, people watching, going to markets and looking at architecture; this is a good place to visit.
Great walk and Superb Cafes. Great shops very interesting and there was a great choice of Cafes to eat at during the day and at night.

Did you want to feel like you were back. in time a few hundred years? The architecture is beyond belief, spend a full day walking around, go under the bridge and vist the observatory for beautiful views of Sydney.

go here for the markets. I go here sometimes for the markets and other times just to go to the shops. The Irish tea shop is nice for tea and scones, and the markets are more upmarket than some others. Good variety of craft, food, and jewellery.
A must do for a visit to Sydney. Spending time wandering around, reading about early Sydney history, cafes, restaurants & markets - what wouldn't be to love?

Stayed around here. I loved being in this area. Was central to all things touristy and yet, after climbing up a way, managed to feel residential. I would not recommend the area to folks out of shape or in a wheelchair. But for able bodies - best place to explore.

Wonderful Area of Sydney!. This is a really great little area of Sydney, with a really vibrant atmosphere and full of lots of great little restaurants and bars. They often have a market, too, which we were lucky enough to stumble upon and there were several really great vendors, so it's definitely worth checking out.
Rocks walk. Rocks, located a Cicular Keay, especially on weekends, Markets place , fine dining, and plenty of Colonial history, a must while in Sydney
Must visit the Rocks. Near to the bridge and harbour, this is a lovely area, old buildings with lots of small restaurants and bars, interesting shops and a market on some days.
great setting. love the history varied restaurants lots of people felt safe although there was a little trouble clean area few police about love the unique shops

Great mix of old and new. This area gives you a real feeling for Sydney. A little touristy but not too much. You can see it all. The old buildings, the rock museum, the custom house (which has a scale model of Sydney in the floor of the entry). Lots of places to eat, The Opera house, Look for the Free bus.

Some cute buildings and hills. Nice area to walk around for an hour or two. On the weekends there is a market with lots of stalls with lots of variety- trinkets, jewelry, food, clothes, souvenirs, etc. A variety of restaurants at different price points--none cheap. This area has many hills and uneven sidewalks--avoid if you have trouble walking or use a stroller.
Good spot for drinks. We visited here for reasonably priced drinks around the harbour bridge area. Good selection of bars to choose from, just go exploring.

Where Sydney Began. Great area to walk around and plenty of free walking tours to tell you the history and show you. Historic parts of the Rocks. Good free museum plenty of good bars and restaurants and all walkable from Sydney Harbour.

Interesting Historical Area. A walk through this area takes you back to the way the first settlers to this area lived. The narrow passages, steep steps, small rooms, and how close together they lived to each other.Visited The Rocks Discovery Museum for more history and information --- very very interesting! Found family names in census logs.As well, how the area has kept this history and are running modern day businesses and restaurants!!
The Rocks. Great area to walk around. On the weekends, there is a nice outdoor market (goods, not produce). We bought local chocolate and local banana bread. Both were excellent.

Fun place to be. We made like four trips to this area because there were restaurants and shops to explore. This is a happening place at night too. On one of our outings, we did the Yoko Ono exhibit - pass up on this one. Her art is as good as her singing. No, worse. A lot worse. But the rest of the Rocks is awesome. People were friendly. Lots of things to see, eat and buy. Outdoor shops under tents were fun too.There was a little bit for all ages.
Busy Place. Lots of business people and tourists around. Busy area for public transport. Worth a visit and walk around, some great shops.
Located in Sydney harbor. Since it is near the Harbor it is a nice area to walk. There are street signs in brown to direct you. The is a walk called the Nusres walk for my Buddie Nurses.

Cant wait to go back. The Rocks is such a great day trip. We've been now several times to 'market day'. We've also at different times, enjoyed breakfast, lunch and dinner. Like Australia itself (and most countries) its a very interesting place w a mixed history. Ask around.

Sunday Market. The Rocks area seems to be going under an urban renewal cycle. To get the full flavor, visit on a Sunday and check out the large street market. For tourists, you wil find an area of unusual and fun localy made momentos (how many t-shirts do you really need?). Lots of good food and drink as well.

Where it all began. The Rocks is the neighborhood wedged between Darling Harbor and Circular Quay where Sydney was first settled. Most of the City's Historic Register buildings are here. There is a great free walking tour every night at 6 p.m. leaving from Cadman's Cottage just off Circular Quay near the Museum of Contemporary Art. You'll go through the excavation sites of the old buildings and think you're in Rome or Greece with all the terraced stone. There is also an Observatory hill with terrific views and a bunch of hotel restaurants throughout with affordable good value meals. Great stories abound in this area of convicts and murders and public hangings and Australia's largest bank robbery. A must!
Restaurants and tourist shops. Lots of shops and restaurants. Quaint but boring. Hilly not an easy walk for seniors. Better places to shop and eat.
Still retains the aura with gentle refurbishment. I am so happy to fine the Rocks is still undergoing a slow renewal which is appropriate and tasteful.

Colonial Sydney- not my kind of thing. Although very beautiful and rare to see with the colonial style architecture and nice little cafes, the entire Rocks area failed to impress me as it felt like a place meant for the much older crowd and wine tasting folks. The place even seemed less bustling but some people may like the soft music and markets.

Very interesting. The place has lots of things to do from interesting places to visit like the garrison church, the rocks discovery museum, the cottages and the villas to the many restaurants and souvenir shops. The place has a very unique character to it and is a pretty interesting place to visit also in retrospect to the times when this place was famous for its notorious nature that had everything from gang wars, to drunken sailors to convicts and murders. The cobbled and narrow alleys around here give a nice picture of these colorful days. These days though the place has become all the bit of touristy with the prices of the many restaurants around here or the souvenir shops.

Great area. We have been to Sydney 3 times now and always end up on the rocks, it's so interesting and pretty. This year we too a 6pm "I'm free" walking tour that opened it up even more and gave us a potted history, well worth doing and the young leaders make their living by your tips if you enjoyed it.

Loads to do. Walked around the rocks and Sydney Harbour, visited the markets at the Rocks. The Markets are awesome just make sure you allow a day to browse all the stalls and little shops.Loads to do, see ,eat, drink.
very expensive to eat out. The Rocks is nice place for walk. Lots of old buildings and restaurants but be prepare for high prices. We still enjoyed it because we had a lunch with a view.

Not much there. I was disappointed by the selection of restaurants. Pricey and not anything of particular appeal. I see no reason to visit that area of the city. You can pass through it on the double deck tour of the city and save yourself the walk.
Touristy. We didn't like the low-grade cafés in one of which we had a dreadful breakfast. The Saturday market is quite enjoyable.

It's all there. Whether you are looking for souvenirs, a drink or something to eat this area has the everything.The standard of food served in the wide variety of restaurants is very good and there are some fantastic restaurants, the Pony for example.As well as the eating places there are some atmospheric, old time, pubs which serve a wide variety of top quality beers and wines.If you are looking for souvenirs there is a wide variety to choose from, especially if looking for Ugg boots and Aboriginal art.It's a great little area for a wander.
Lots of history here.... Interesting architecture, guided tours(or you can easily stroll and read the signs) some great pubs and cafes and market stalls during the weekends.

Very trendy and historical. Lots of history about the origins of Australia in this area but they've done a great job in integrating history with trendy establishments and small boutiques and restaurants. Loved exploring this area of Sydney.
Lovely Area!. Great place, lovely to just walk around and check out the markets! Old houses provide a warm, interesting, historical touch to this popular hangout.

historic Sydney. We went on a guided walking tour of The Rocks which was very interesting .the guide was friendly ,informative and spoke clearly. 90 mins was about the right amount of time to get a feel for some of the history and to see the important sights.

Interesting place just a bit touristy. Prime location as it is just 2 streets away from Circular Quay, a nice cosy place to feel some 'flea market' in a weekend! A bit touristy but the small streets behind the major part were full of old buildings, offering an authentic local feel! Worth to go in a weekend afternoon!
Loved the Rocks. Great location - right next to Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. Lots of restaurants and shops. Fun to walk around. I loved it so much I got a hotel for three nights there.

Touristy but a must see!. Theres a pancake house down there - one of few places doing 24 hr proper food, great views of Opera House, a nice walk down there past old pubs and a real feeling of what it must've been like for those first arrivals all those years ago - feels a bit like a western movie scene!

Nice Place. Beautiful place for walks in the afternoons, lots of different stores and restaurants.
Totally recommended!
Great location. As a location, it's full of bars and restaurants and a few minutes walk to the main shopping area of Sydney. You can also walk to the Opera House and Botanic Gardens.

Bridge Climb Venue. The Rocks area I believe is where the prisoners landed many years ago , no real reminders of this , but a nice oldish area of Sydney en route to the Sydney Bridge climb , nice cafes in the area and Yoko Ono exhibition .
On the rocks!. Great place to meander through the streets and take in the sites,smells and sounds. We enjoyed the relaxing stroll - it was busy when we visited but this added to the atmosphere

Good for a look. This old part of sydney is definitely worth a look. It is pretty and there are a few free museums to look. It also has quite a large market which is awesome to see, the highlight for me was seeing a man spray painting art, he was so clever.
Great in the weekends. Great area with lots of shops and restaurants. In the weekends they do have a lot of outside stalls with local handicrafts etc. Ibteresting place
Nice Shops and Area. Area very well kept with lots of restaurants, bars and shops. Bought my Ugg boots here at a great price.

Sit at a sidewalk cafe. If the weather is great, find a spot at a sidewalk cafe and prepare to spend the afternoon! It was wonderfully relaxing to enjoy the neighborhood and taste through the beer selections.
A nice neighborhood, seems like it's out of the business of CBD Sydney.

A good heritage walk. Nice area but do not expect a long day out. The free museum is a must to help understand the area. Walk around but by afternoon expect to find more to look at. Best bit of Sydney history.

Historic Neighborhood. The Rocks is an historic neighborhood just off the Circular Quay. It was settled by recently released convicts from the Sydney prison. The history of the British using Sydney as a prison colony is quite a story. Many historic buildings have been preserved, and there are plenty of places to eat and shop. On weekends, there is a market with many crafts and foods to sample.

Funky, fun, touristy, historic.. I love The Rocks area of Sydney and I love markets, especially if they're less commercial and kinda quirky, so I adore these! Set in an ideal location in The Rocks, so right Circular Quay, you cannot go wrong and especially as there are lots of food and drink options in the area too offering a great deal of choice. The only negative I can think of is the parking situation which is pretty much non-existent but remember this is Sydney so it is a massive issue already. The Markets run at the weekends and I think there's a food market on the Friday?! I love the wide variety on products and goods on sale here, particularly the jewellery as I do love my accessories and it's even better when you know they've been made with love and no one else is going to be wearing them! Infact I'm wearing one of the beautiful necklaces I recently bought on a beautifully warm and sunny day in Sydney, just here in London town on a drizzly day yet it still looks as bright and stunning as when I picked it out that day and reminds me of another fab time in Sydney and at The Rocks and I've received loads of compliments on it too. The stallholders are friendly and welcoming and many chat to you and tell you stories about the pieces they've made / are selling. Make this one of your must visit hotspots in Sydney - whether you're a local or a tourist - you won't be disappointed!

Rock at the Rocks.. We took public transportation from near our Darling Harbour hotel and walked from the end of the bus line to the small but excellent Rocks museum. We also saw some colonial buildings as well as older and classic buildings in the area. This is a very historic area that is a "must see" for visitors to Sydney, Australia.
So cute and hip!!. So nice to walk around on a Sunday when all the markets are on. they have some great food stalls and great little gift stalls.
Quaint and historic. Wonderful little area, with cafes and shops in historic area. Nice for walking, but be prepared for the hills and steps.

Basically a tourist trap. This area is very popular with tourists. Although there are lots of old buildings in The Rocks it is now an area where indoor and outdoor restaurants, pubs and boutique shops are located. On weekends the outdoor market is also a drawcard selling mostly souvenirs and local "artists" works.

The place where you want to get lost and never go back!. the Rocks according to me is the best place in Sydney to go to... during the normal day hours, its a bustling little scenic place with people sitting around, fishing and doing nothing... at nights it becomes the best haunting walk spot, if you are lucky and brave enough, there are the ghost hunting walks that happen at nights around this area. over the weekends, the Rocks converts into the best flea market you ever visited! with live music by the prominent musicians of Australia... you surely wouldnt want your day to end when you go there over a weekend :D
Distinctive. Loved it! It reminded me a little of the old town area of Barcelona."Love on the rocksLove on the rocksShe's my shotLove on the rocks"
Nice stroll. Nice area to just stroll, if the markets are on its a bonus. beautiful old area. lots of café and restaurants to try and a few drink spots.
Great area of Sydney. Excellent area for shops and restaurants. Weekend market is great. Only problem is the crowds from the cruise ships docking nearby.
charming!. This is one of my favorite lesser known areas of Syndey. It's like a different world with the old buildings, little ships, and cobbled lanes. It's so charming and nice to have a stroll!

A stroll down memory lane..... The rocks Sydney is an amazing array of old meets new. A historical past coupled with modern buildings sets the unique scene. Cobbled laneways starts the story of our beginnings and history of Sydney with quaint dwellings and hidden surprises.
Historic buildings. The Rocks are directly next to the Harbor. The old historic buildings were well maintained and it was a charming area. We walked this area both evenings and ate at their pubs.

Walkabout at The Rocks. Took a walking tour of The Rocks and quite enjoyed learning about the history, i.e., Sydney's beginnings. Lots of interesting alleyways to go down with interesting names, e.g. Nurses' Walk; a good choice of restaurants for lunch or dinner, with very good food.

Rocks - a tourist trap especially on a Sunday. This is not the real Sydney, its just seemed like a tourist trap to me... yes they are some nice expensive restaurants and some nice shops, and a Sunday market. But on the Sunday I went it was just so full of tourists, and yes there was a cruise ship in.It wasn't my cup of tea... mind you I'm not a shopper... The best part of the rocks is going through the Rocks to get to the Pylon lookout and the Bridge, or to the Glenmore pub which is at the top of the Rocks... which had nice views from the rooftop, and did steaks for 12 asd each on a Monday night

Cool area. The Rocks extends out from Circular quay so it is beside the Harbour Bridge and not far from the opera house. The area is full of bars and restaurants and is great for an evening out. The Rocks itself is like an old English settlement, once you cross the park from Circular Quay, in a way you feel like you're no longer in Sydney! Worth an evening stroll around!
Unique experience. You have not experiences Sydney until you spend a week-end hanging out in "The Rocks" Lots of cool stuff going on, many small and interesting restaurants to hang out at.

Historic Wonder!. A great historic place to explore. I only wish I'd spent more time exploring some of the historic sites and checking out cafes etc! Go on the weekend and enjoy the markets. Great atmosphere!

Superbly charming!. Explore The Rocks on foot is a must while in Sydney! It is superb and an elegant mix of old and new. To think that they almost leveled the area for high-rise condos some years ago! I hope they maintain this area just like that for many years to come! It is priceless!

Very pretty. Made for both tourists and locals - great place to walk around.
Fabulous views and great place to people watch.
No doubt touristy, but still a fun place with great energy.

The center of Sydney. This place is a hubbub of activity along the city side of the bay. Historical as the place of landing for the first Australian settlers, it is now a place of recreation and shops that leave little to desire. Lots of people watching and places to shop for those needed souvenirs.

Vintage Sydney. The Rocks is the oldest area in Australia. It was the first European settlement – mostly military and convicts. It is filled with historical buildings museums and stories. Take a tour or get a map and explore by yourself. The Rocks Museum a good place to start. There are cool restaurants, bars and shops. It is a little touristy now but the history is everywhere. They have a great weekend market also.

Great place. Good atmosphere and picturesque part of this vibrant city. There are free tour guides to show you round although we didn't use as we took this in at our own pace. Visited several times for a relaxing drink overlooking the bridge
Lots to see. Really enjoyed exploring all the shops and stalls around the Rocks. Has the best information office, nothing was too much trouble for them. Walked through to get to the Harbour Bridge
Supurb at Night. This place has an aura about it during the evening, with all the buildings lit up, and during the Christmas period, it really is a special part of Sydney that needs to be explored.

Spend a day and night exploring this area. We wandered narrow alleys, main streets,explored the shops and local pubs. The pubs were the focus as we moved from pub to pub (weekend) listening to the bands and watching the locals. The Rocks are a great way to learn some history of Sydney, view the local Arts and music scene.

Great place to get one of a kind gifts. The Sat and Sun market is great. There are a ton of artists selling thier wares. I got a really nice silk scarf and other gifts. This is a lively market with nice stuff, not ceap stuff you can get around town in shops.
Quirky. Interesting little windy streets and historical pubs, worth a vist, only 5 mins walk from Circular quay.

Pleasant place. The rocks is a pleasant place to visit when in Sydney. There are lots of eating places to choose from. Although the best area is Darling Harbour for the sheer number of restaurants to choose from.
Activity. Nice leisurely stroll with a bit of hussle and bussle. Lots of cafes and food places to choose from. Also check out the cobble stoned paves and heritage

Interesting and Insightful. It was nice to see the heritage buildings and we were lucky to have the Rocks Marketplace on a Sunday. The mix of wares displayed was very interesting - fossil rocks to interest my young one while funky jewellery for me. Remember - the market is there only on Saturday and Sunday!!
Great experience. Go back in time and take in the rocks. It is really a class act it is about as authentic as any part of Sydney its history is interesting

What's left of the original City of Sydney. Here you find the spirit of the first Sydney inhabitants (european!)
visit the Lord Nelson Hotel and taste their fantastic beer, and if you can get a table there, have a dinner - it's very gopod

Nice historic area. As one of the earliest areas to be settled this has a lot of history. The architecture reflects this and there are some very interesting buildings. Good for cosy restaurants but as it is on the main tourist route is very expensive.

Shopping and great food. Wonderful section of town to just wander through.
You can get a glass of wine at a cafe ... or a coffee ... and the restaurants are excellent.

Awesome, Hip, Cool....Pick One!!. Really nice area. Very trendy with shops, art galleries, and restaurants. On the weekend they have a market with all types of awesome crafts, food, clothing etc. At night it becomes a party palace with upscale clubs and lounges playing cool music and providing a chill environment. The Rocks was awesome!!!

fab for window shopping and inspiration. I loved the rocks for inspiration but the prices are extortionate. I wanted opals but jeez they're pricy here. There are tons of jewellers here. I also looked for Uggs but again over priced and not confident they were Oz made Go with your eyes open and take your tourist goggles off and its great  I liked the mix of old and new but could help not help but smile when considering when 200 odd years is considered to be old But well worth it and although I'm critical I could happily go back and window shop some more :-) I loved the Markets too at the weekend

Expected More History. We visited The Rock in the daytime and in the evening--two contrasting visits. The daytime was very low key, and while the area is historically important to Sydney, I didn't get the feeling that a lot of energy had gone into making it clear to tourists. There was a little museum and an old house and small "reproduction" store, but it was quiet. The historic aspects and significant buildings lacked signage and there wasn't a place to get a clear image of what that early settlement was like (dioramas, diaries, a short movie, scale models of ships) --nothing "brought it to life". At night there was a bit more romance to the area, with a variety of interesting lighting, the harbor lights and the beautiful Opera House glowing on the other , and a few of the bars having live music, including the oldest bar in Sydney. It was a very nice location for a stroll, to get a couple of beers and listen to a band, or window shop.

A Big Disappointment!. This small area near the bridge didn't do it for us. Mostly high priced shops and very high priced restaurants and bars. We walked the area twice on different days to see if our views would change, unfortunately not.It did not have the charm and character we were looking for.
Lovely area. I love the rocks, it is such a lovely beautiful place.It has the history, the views and the food. Do a walking tour to make sure you don't miss out on anything

Wished it was open. We got here late and meandered around the area. Wish we hadn't missed most of the openings, because they looked good. It is really nice to see the old part of Sydney being revived and dug up - literally! Stall a lot of information on plaques about the whole area. Nice part of the city.
Tourist haven, but great place for souvenirs. We arrived in time for the weekend market, and returned several more times to purchase souvenirs from upscale vendors.

Quaint Historic Town. Be sure to walk through the cobbled streets of this neighborhood. The history is immense and they have preserved the stories and tales from the founding days. Plenty of shops and restaurants to enjoy, as well as great views. Meet up with friends for drinks and fun!

Stroll around to see Old Sydney. There are lots of independent shops in this area, a cobbled road which gives the feel of what Old Sydney was like plus some old buildings dating back to the 1800s and more. I was there on a Friday and there were lots of food stalls, not sure if this is the only day for this market. Great place to meet friends and have a drink and a bite to eat.

Old Sydney. This historic area of old Sydney has been developed--with taste--into a major touristic area, and prices are accordingly high in most shops and restaurants; but the old streets and walkways are truly pleasant to walk in, the historic buildings are excellent to view, and in a few spots you can find houses still lived in by ordinary Sydney residents, and pubs which are local rather than driven mainly by the tourist trade. In good weather the outdoor cafes and wine bars are especially attractive features. This is a must-see area, right up there along with the Harbour Bridge (which runs through/over part of The Rocks) and the harbour itself (beside/around it).
Walk all over to really see it. It is so walkable, with all kinds of little alleys, shops, bistros and tons of history. Check out the Rocks museum, and the pathway to the bridge.
Good food!. From November untill ?? there are food stands every friday night combined with creative activities and forms of art. Very nice to visit!

A Little Slice of History. This area has so much history .The sandstone buildings are beautiful. we visited the markets which are filled with gorgeous clothing crafts jewellery & places to eat. Will return soon with some friends to enjoy this lovely place.
A Bit of History. The old buildings give the area a feeling of the history of the area. Yes, the rock walls add to this interesting area. Lots of restaurants and cafés to sit back and enjoy.

Fun. This is the old, but upscale, neighbourhood of the city. We first came here to try out the famous pancakes, and have since returned several times just to walk around and while the evening away over a few drinks. There are some nice views to be had as well.

History Personified. Located adjacent to Sydney Harbour, The Rocks is a great place to visit for history buffs, shoppers and sightseers. It has markets, restaurants, pubs, boutique shops, buskers and plenty of history to take in. The buildings are some of the first in Sydney and date back some 200 years, a photographers paradise.

Walked through on the way to the bridge. Lovely upscale neighborhood with restaurants and cruise ship terminal. We walked from Circular Quay to the stairs that take you up to the pedestrian walkway over the Harbor Bridge. Definitely worth a visit.

The Old Heart of Sydney.. I've had the pleasure to both work and visit the 'Rocks' ! I worked as a bouncer at the Merc' for several years and before and since have always gravitated to the area. And why not , you have a plethora of Pubs from the Fortune of War , The Orient , The Merchantile, The Harbour View , Lord Nelson , The Hero of Waterloo ,The Glenmore , The Australian etc , etc , etc !!! Some great boutique beer pubs !! Plus great trendy restaurants , Phillips Foot , Overseas Passenger Terminal , Pancakes etc , etc !! Markets on Friday nights and Sunday plus a great walk past Sydneys oldest history , Cadmans Cottage, Sailors Home , Dawes Point , Historical buildings etc , etc ! If you can't enjoy the Rocks you are in a coma !!!

The Rocks - great day out. Great location, views, entertainment. Really good place to visit with friends. Close to all the major tourist attractions. Short ferry trip round to Darling Habour. It has everything!!!

A glorious day at the Rocks. Such a vibrant, happening place to visit. It has the markets, buskers, pubs, restaurants, boutique shopping, cruise liners coming & going...the list goes on. Very vibrant place, a must see for tourists.

Nice place to walk. We were on a city tour and got off at the Harbour Bridge to walk to "The Rocks". Cool area with great restaurants and shops in a renovated district, predominantly old brick buildings and small streets and a lively bar and restaurant scene. A great place just to walk around, where it's nice to spend a few hours looking through the many types of shop, as well the interesting market with a multitude of stalls selling antiques, crafts and others.
Great area with tons of options!. We stayed at the holiday inn in the rocks...excellent location! A couple minute walk to the circular quay and tons of restaurants and shops closeby!

The rocks. I was born and bread in Sydney out of all of Sydney I love the rocks I love the buildings I love the markets it is so nice to walk around the rocks you see something new going on all the time I love the restaurant one to suit everyone depending on taste and if you love historical buildings you will find plenty here and yes there are restrooms

Many things to many people. If you like charm of yesteryear, shopping from outlets that remind you of an era enjoyed long ago, having a drink at a bar or a pub, walking by the water, enjoy history or ornate architecture then you will find it all here.Arriving after midday and planning to be around for a few hours is the best plan and usually in late spring or summer if you really want to enjoy all that this precinct has to offer.
History of Sydney. The Rocks is a very historic part of the Sydney city. Lined with old building and situated on the water, it is a lovely place to visit, dine and tour.
Beautiful Harbour. The Rocks has great markets, lots of restaurants and pubs. Very nice place to go for the day, walking around and viewing the beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Sunday day out. Rocks a good visit on weekends when there are many stalls and markets available. Or during the week visit the many restaurants or shops available. Excellent tourist destination and close to Sydney Harbour.

Good to wander thru. The Rocks is an older part of Sydney on the harbour just at the bottom of the city center. It has some amazing buildings, great old pubs and on weekends street markets. It IS a tourist place though so rather expensive but it's a lovely place to wander around and from there you can continue on around the foreshore to the Opera House.
It Rocks!. Full of Australian history and Colonial architecture this part of Sydney is must see. Full of traditional pubs and modern Australia restaurants it is a great night out.

Historic with a hint of modernism. I often visit the Rocks Sydney when I have meetings which we usually dine at our favourite restaurant Phillips Foote.The rocks has many stores including designer brands. I can't say it's not expensive to shop here but it's Sydney after all so everything is expensive.The restaurants are great here. I recommend Phillips Foote as it's a great small restaurant and it's a fun environment. You get to cook your now steak and salads and sauces are for free.Due to some of the buildings, The Rocks is quiet interesting. Being close to the Quay does help otherwise you can only so much shop at Burberry...If your in Sydney from interstate or your from overseas, I suggest a visit to the Rocks. I recommend you visit Phillips Foote and the Galleria. After that cross the road and go walk to the Opera House.
The BEST Place to Eat, Drink, and be Merry. There are so many terrific places to eat, drink, and shop in this historic district that you just can't miss it. The food and atmosphere are both great!

What Fun! Alive and Vibrant. Was in Sydney twice, at the beginning and end of a larger trip to Australia. Ended up cancelling my planned hotel for the second stay after visiting The Rocks on the first stay. Booked into a Rocks hotel and increased the enjoyment factor by a bunch!
Recommended tor everyone.
The Rocks. Great place to visit. First you have to take the tour it is free and you will have an overview of the place. Then walk, walk and walk.Something different not to be missed.
The Rocks, Sydney. A part of Sydney well preserved from the 18th and 19th centuries. Oldest pubs in Australia are in the area.

Old Sydney. One must visits The Rocks area of Sydney as this was the area that was the original area of Sydney.It is a tourist area, but gives one the feel of what Sydney was like a few hundred years ago. Their tare many shops and cafes.The restaurants tend to be over prices,but the ambience of sitting out on Sydney Harbour is worth the price.
Must see part of town. The Rocks rocks. Loads of pubs and restaurants. Lord Nelson well worth a stop. Whole area is in marked contrast to CBD and Darling Harbour.
Go!. Historical district and close to Sydney Harbour and the Opera House.Several pubs and excellent restaurants.Recommend a visit to this place.

A place to check out with street markets and charm. My wife and I visited the rocks on one of our two days in Sydney. The rocks is just west of Circular Quay, and in easy walking distance. When we visited, it was lined with many businesses and was enjoyable to walk along. When we first arrived we were hungry and found a joint we were unable to locate on google maps after the fact. The food was good, but we regret tipping around 13% when apparently tipping like that isn't needed in Australia (and it was not cheap food).Overall it was a great experience. There were a ton of unique gifts to buy (though except for a xmas ornament we abstained), the street market a diverse set of stuff up for sale.

Nothing crazy special. Just an old "downtown". Nothing all that amazing that I would put it in a must see category. It is nice if you can make it , but I wouldn't make it a mandatory stop. Cool of you are with buddies and looking to get crunk and bar hop

Real Sydney. The oldest part of town now very much a tourist attraction. Lorts to see and do especially if you are there on a market day.The Hofbrahaus pub is a must, German beer, Oompah Band and great entertainment for all, including some audience participation

Rockin' in The Rocks, Sydney. Step back in time and feel the past all around you in Sydney's 'Rocks' area. History abounds and the shopping, dining and bar/pub life is terrific. It's a 'happy' place to visit as everyone is there for the same reason ... to have a good time! It is a must see on your Sydney itinerary or ... if a local ... don't forget to add it to your must-do list on the odd occasion. It is always a great morning, day, afternoon or night out! (And don't forget there are markets as well).

Spend a little time here. Easy to walk here from the city (approx 30 mins). We saw 3 different big cruise liners docked on various days. Soaked up the atmosphere and enjoyed lunch outside the Guylian cafe - lovely salads and iced coffees - accompanied by a visiting parakeet - good photos!Nice shops to wander round and a little less hustle and bustle than in the city though still busy with tourists. Good base to set off for the Sydney bridge climb
A great area. A great area full of cafés and restaurants.There is also a super market, but don't expect market prices ...everything is really expensive!!!

Lovely during the weekend. The rocks is a lovely visit during the weekend where the markets set a nice lively atmosphere. Roadside cafes & restaurants are welcoming in & around for a leisurely stopover for lunch. If it's a sunny day, you'll have a lovely relaxed time :)

A lovely historic area. One of my favourite areas in Sydney and definitely worth a stroll around. There is an overpriced but still rather nice market on Saturdays and Sundays and plenty of spots to sit and admire on of the many great views here.

Can't really change the rocks. its a piece of history of Australia that will never change and will always remain the same. Visit the rocks for the Markets or speciality shops such as Honey Bee World. close to circular Quay.

Beer and Dinner. A short walk from my hotel and we were at the Fortune of War Pub to relax with old friends and a draft Teweys New Beer . Then on to Phillips Foote Restaurant for a terrific Steak dinner and more Aussie beer! The Rocks are a pleasant walk with a lot of shops, restaurants and pubs; very enjoyable.

A special part of Sydney. Still the best part of Sydney to see and feel the history. Perhaps becoming overgrown with tourist sites and shops but in amongst it all, you can still sense the beginnings of Sydney

Exploring where convicts first landed at Sydney. The Rocks is a compact area easily accessed by foot. The vistas of the harbor, bridge and opera house are excellent. One street is devoted to vendors which has tight spaces. Overall excellent experience.

Magical place. This is a great spot to go hang out in a pub, or wander around shopping and people watching. There is a great Friday night market nov and dec and sat and sun markets. I love the way pubs and restaurants are built right into the rocks. Great historical area. Shops are pricy though as this is the cruise ship stop!

Magnificent place. It is worth visiting the Rocks at the weekend when you can enjoy the bazaar of applied crafts, to drink a cold beer, to enjoy the view of the Opera and listen to music provided generously by street musicians.Magnificent place.

A Sunday,strolling around the flea market. Nice part of the city for a Sunday walk. Many people walking around, shopping or just having their coffee in the open air. Mostly clothes and accessories ....and homemade sweets.
Early Australian History - easily accesible. Australian White Settlement has its roots in The Rocks. Easily accessible, it demands a day to wander

Nice area. This area is ideal to walk around in. There are shops, cafés, and restaurants. Plenty to select from. On the weekend they had food booths, live music and vendors of crafts and candy. Great place to look at historic buildings and find a great restaurant.

A step back in time with modern fittings. Loved it. All the streets and buildings still retain their colonial charm with clever architectural and interior decor blends for upmarket living and dining. A unique experience right in the heart of the city.

The history of this area was fasinating. We walked and walked and really enjoyed the little streets with stories and history and if you got tired of walking there was great little friendly pubs everywhere.

Worth visiting to walk around and explore this interesting and historic area- readily accessible. The Rocks area is part of Sydney's history.
It's readily accessible from the CBD and the Harbor tourist area, and it's worth visiting.
There's shops, cafés and restaurants, with a charming "olde worlde" atmosphere.
Well worth a visit!

Very neat area, a must visit for Sydney tourists. Central location to the major Sydney landmarks around Circular Quay (Opera House and the Bridge), but just off the beaten path enough to avoid SOME of the crowds. Walking around the Rocks area felt like a totally new part of Sydney with the streets and buildings. Wish I could have explored and actually stayed here! This was a solo trip so I stayed more in the CBD area but I would have loved to have stayed in this area with my wife - next trip!
Nice area. It's a nice hipster area behind the Sydney Harbour... it looked really cool with a lot of fun shops... look forward to going back
Fashionable. Sydneys first settlement was here, with the "Oldest" bar in Australia being here. Very trendy and upscale...a must see.

Lovely Sunday Market. The Rocks is a great place to have a drink or dinner during the week or at the weekend. Plenty of great views of the harbour. And some exciting restaurants. Further there is a grat weekend on Sundays.

An example of redevelopment. Restaurants, shops in old warehouses and factories. Market on Saturdays that are fun and actually for once has items one might wish to buy. Not the usual crap one sees at these markets

Fun, historical district. This area is home to a mix of high end hotels and shops to hostels and pubs. There is something for everyone, including historic walks, the Harbour Bridge and fun little shops.
It is easy to get lost for hours in the meandering streets so set a landmark and take off from there.
Very historic. Steeped in history but very cool at the same time. Esp. liked the café (Bakehouse?) that had a courtyard out the back. Great food and service, and very reasonably priced.
Market fun. The weekend market was fun and tempting ( spent more than I should have). The old buildings and stores kept us walking and gawking.

A must see.. Took a walking tour and found it very interesting and informative about the early history of Sydney. Our tour guide was very good.
There is also a market on the weekends.
a hidden gem. interesting - querky - well worth exploring at night - good restuarants - good bars - and reasonable gift shops..Best avoided when a cruise ship is in town!!

Beautiful area. Good shopping, great buildings and with the Australian light basking on it. Discovered the Aboriginal Art museum - good buys there. Sailor Thai Canteen - loud and not worth the hype.Get some great shots of the Bridge in the back and also visit the market - very Covent Garen-esque! Live music, great food - the wraps were to die for! Especially the sweet, pesto,walnuts, spinach and goats cheese! Definitely worth a visit

Full of character. This is a great location and full of everything you could want--history, shops, restaurants and pubs. The market on Saturday and Sunday mornings is great for wandering around and shopping. There are a lot of preserved buildings that give the area charm and character.

Book your stay on the Rocks. Old Sydney is beautiful. Cobblestone alleys with sidewalk cafes, pubs and shopping. Great festivals and food vendors on the weekends. Great nightlife at 1909 and Argoyle. Stay on or near The Rocks if possble for a close-to-everything feel.

Great place for unique shopping. We would ever believe that you would find such a market in the middle of historic Sydney. The preserved streets and the wonderful market are one of the highlights of Sydney. I have been to the Grand Bazaar in Instanbul and this market is just as much fun.
great place to visit and stay. old fashioned houses and pubs centrally located with good resturants and old fashioned hotels, and easy walking of cbd and the bridge and harbourside

Lots of history and "secret" hideout. Love this area. its where Sydney started. It has a kind of rustic feel with many hidden alleys and gems. I did this area on a walking tour with Im Free and i learnt so much about this place and was much better able to appreciate it. There are many nice restaurants and pubs in this area so it will be a good idea to have your lunch/dinner here.
Always Vibrant and Great Dining Options. A great place to wander, take in the sights and relax. Plenty of good food and drinking options which should appeal to every taste.

Fantastic Sunday outing. We recently visited this old area of Sydney with a group of friends and found it to be an excellent way to fill in a Sunday afternoon. The market stalls were well set up with lots of different offerings. There were no tacky or cheap and nasty products on display. I purchased a gorgeous hand made necklace and earrings from a lovely lady who was extremely helpful. We had lots of rummaging through the clothes and scarves and jewellery in one particular shop found indoors. There were lots of visitors around and there was a lovely friendly happy atmosphere to enjoy. Cafés were busy with outdoor dining and lots of chatting etc. I have visited this area previously and was very pleased to find it still provided the best of Sunday markets. I love The Rocks and definitely recommend it as an area of Sydney not to be missed. I will definitely return.

Great Don't miss area. Don't miss the Saturday street market and pick any of the small bars or restaurants to eat in. They close of the streets for the market for several blocks. The stalls in the market included street food as well as artwork. There were sausages over a foot long and since it was Oktoberfest there was band outside of the German restaurant. Don't miss the plate size schnitzel - enough to share or the friendly singing in the back room.

Walking tour. We found the walking tour(starting near the watch tower) to be very interesting and informative. The volunteer (Leisa) led us through the history and stories of the Rocks and brought the city and its beauty onto a different level. It is well worth the time

Shop, shop, shop. The area is nothing but shops, galieries and restaurants and that is a good thing. It is a very old area of the city, many of the establishments are in former merchant homes. The area can have dramatic views. 1 of the oldest pubs and hotels, the Lord Nelson Brewery and hotel is located here. Nice place to spend a few hours.

Great Sunday market!. For great souvenirs, people watching, and food in a historic part of Sydney visit the Rocks. The market is huge and full of crafts, jewelry, nice clothing, etc. I love the goats milk soap, black and white photo of Sydney, glassware, sand stone vases and candle holders, and silk blouses. Enjoy!
Great way to spend a day. Area full of pubs, restaurants and shops. You can't miss in the Rocks. Lots to explore and see. Do yourself a favor and check it out.
lovely place to stay. loved the rocks area nice shops & weekend market greatbest place to staywish we did the rocks tour at 1830 but limited time

A trip to bygone architecture, with lovely shops!. Lovely place to visit if you like old fashioned, well-maintained architecture with a lovely selection of interesting one-off shops and restaurants. Not the place to bargain hunt, but definitely the place to source a unique memento of Sydney, whether jewellery, clothing or art work. Try to visit on Fri - Sun, when a street market is full of goodies such as farm-bottled olive oils and vinegars.Enjoy!

Roks rock on a Sunday. Happened to be in Sydney on a Sunday and took a stroll around the Rocks area. Large display of market stalls and lovely eating places. Great way to fill in a few hours in the lovely city

Great area. We stayed in this area at the YHA hostel and it is fun and very central. There are tons of bars and restaurants but it take some exploring to find everything. There are many stairs so it tested our fitness. We enjoyed the Saturday market.

A very historic and interesting part of old Sydney. Great old pubs, cobbled streets and a wonderful place on the weekends when there is a wide variety of stalls in the marketplace where you can pick up interesting trinkets and souvenirs.

A great scenic and hisitorical walk!. Don't miss strolling around these streets and "popping in and out" the quaint shops and tasty food and drink. After the Opera House and taking photos of the scenic city, this is the place to spend your time.

One of My Favourite Parts of Sydney. Walked thru' in the day, lunch beer etc as you do - went back next evening for the FREE walking tour which was real fun and informative about the Rocks, its history, some of its characters, its buildings and its pubs ! We had a great dinner in Italian café/bistro. Went back again for the food market on Sat too.

Street Food Delight. Everytime I have been here there is a street food fair or stalls selling handmade products. Great food, great prices, all outside. Grab a hot sandwich and sit on the wall listening to the street artist

Fun to Walk around but not too much to do. Make sure you go to the Rocks during a food fair, or the street fair. There are shops and a few art galleries, but we did a lot of walking and not much shopping. There is a great bar/restaurant there that serves up over 100 types of beer!!! Highly recommend the kangaroo pizza, and two flights of beer. A great lunch stop.

Solo Traveller. The Rocks is an excellent way to see Sydney. It has many of the first hotels dotted around the area showing the early architecture and also complimented by the new hotels where you can enjoy a wide range of food or relax over a drink at any of the bars in the area. Walking around the area you take in the harbour views, shop for gifts and enjoy the early history of Australia or sit and relax and take in the view watching the water traffic including the ferries and fellow travellers and locals all enjoying what the area has to offer. Definitely a spot to give a visitor a range of photographic choices and memories.
Interesting, but wasn't blown away. I found my visit to the Rocks interesting, but I didn't feel like there was a huge amount to see here compared with other attractions in Sydney
Very nice. Very nice area, lots to do and see. Walked around the area with my fiancé and we had a great day. Would definitely come back again.

Great Historic area of Sydney. What a neat little area. So much history but not only that very neat pubs, bars and eateries. So quaint. We were with a very large group so had a private party at the Argyle Pub. What a fantastic place. Just walking around the area is great.

Great way to spend your weekend. We came on a Saturday and was able to walk the weekend Rocks Market which was interesting to see the locals sell their arts and crafts. The handicrafts were unique and not seen at other markets, but also not cheap. Besides shopping at the market, it was also a very nice walk through this historic part of Sydney. This is a great way to experience Sydney on a weekend, walk through the historic beautiful buildings and enjoy your meal at the café/restaurants and people watch.
The rocks. We found the rocks area to be delightful with it's historic buildings. On the weekend we visited, there was a street market with a wide variety of stalls with good prices.
really nice architechture. really nice buildings to check out and great views of the harbour. Great way to spend the afternoon walking around. Lots of pubs in this area too

Great Market!. I don;t usually enjoy markets, too much cheap crafts and things I could do myself. But The Rocks Markets are high class, stunning items. I had a ball and spent far far far too much :) From silver gum leaves to spray painting paintings to little gold and glass figurings, well worth a visit!
A nice place to get lost in. Spent the day wandering the Rocks both the market and the cafe's. It was a perfect day just to wander and look around the old part of Sydney

Good sightseeing. I absolutely enjoyed strolling along the interesting shops and houses. Do visit the shops and cafes at the area for a splendid experience. I felt like I was taken back into time while gazing at the buildings in the area.
Wonderful mix of old and new.. Great area....and not just the harbour and the Opera house. It's full of little streets, great restaurants and neat little shops.

Interesting!. The Rocks was fantastic for getting an overview of Sydney's history dating back to the Aboriginals and Early Settlers period. It was a joy to walk down the cobblestone streets with it's lovely period buildings. Visit the Rocks Museum (free entry) for some interesting facts and information. There are many lovely cafe's and shops. I was lucky to be there whilst the Foodie's Market was on which had some fabulous food and crafts.

rocking in the rocks.. started our bike tour here. what a wonderful neighborhood with specialty shops and eateries. We would have probably missed this wonderful area, if the bike tour hadn't brought us there. Went back later for meals. it's like a quiet little alcove of Sydney
Great place to walk about. The tourist area for Sydney tourists. Lots of great museums and sites to see. Many many great places to eat. Something for everyone.
hidden treasure. what an amazing places and opera views, and the bridge just stunning to watch sunset from the opera side like beeing in heaven.
Great afternoon..fun & informative. Had a great time exploring The Rocks, fun places to see. Great place to sit and have a drink and let the world go by.

The Rocks Rock. Just fantastic. A taste of history & on Fridays at taste of local cuisine from the region. I hate shopping but I loved the genuinely interesting things that can be seen, eaten & purchased here. A must see. must do place if you are in Sydney.
Slightly overrated, but very enjoyable. This is definitely a fun place to walk around and find a nice restaurant, but once or twice was enough for me.
market day. visited on sunday morning when the markets are set up,stroll around this venue and pick up some great gifts to take home , which are a lot cheaper than the shops at the airport
Lots to look at. Wow so many shops and eating places you are spoilt for choice. Nice to see a modern city keeping some of the old historical buildings and making good use of them.

Interesting and lively. We stayed in the Rocks area last time we were in Sydney and we very much enjoyed it. I loved the historical walks and the fact it is walking distance to great restaurants, cafes, the harbour, etc.

The oldest spot. Understood that this was the first area and the oldest part of Sydney when the first group of prisoners were sent here. By the looks of the building - you will know that it was very historical. There are lots of high-end shopping here with good food.

Great spot to look around. We stayed here for a few days and we just loved it there are so many old buildings and alleyways it felt like we were a world away from busy Sydney. There are a lot of great food places and the markets on Sat and Sun were great we loved looking around, they also had great food available.

Shopping, Food, Close to Opera House & Habour Bridge. There were great places to eat, stay, shop, etc. There was some kind of festival going on one of the days and that was great. My wife and I enjoyed trying the different kinds of foods from the street vendors and also eating meals at the quaint restaurants. We really enjoyed this area as it was an easy walk to the Opera House and bridge.
Great area. Stayed in this area, lots of alleyways, eateries, bars etc. the Australian hotel has a quiz on a Wednesday, great atmosphere there

Nice place. Nice place to immerse oneself in the early history. Get your self to the museums / galleries. Was walking through the small lanes and discovered that there were written historical facts on the walls of the buildings, describing the arrivals of the Settlers to The Rocks. Not much ppl knows this but good place to get lost in for a full day.
The Historic Tour. I have enjoyed The Rocks because there is so much history to be shared. If you enjoy the past history of Sydney, This is a must for you.
Oh the Histroy. Lovely little quiet area of Sydney that we enjoyed exploring with its old buildings and cobbled streets and interesting little lanes.

Historic and Vibrant. Loved the weekend markets. So many options for art and history within a small area. Found the acrobats by the cruise ship talented but found their comments offensive and far from witty. These were an insult to visiting tourists.
Quaint and vibrant. This is a charming, Bohemian shopping area--dozens of small shops interspersed with restaurants and coffee shops. A don't-miss experience.

Great walk.... We only had a few days in Sydney, but we did spend time down at The Rocks, great shopping and food! Make sure to bring your purse!!! Very expensive if your from the US, lunch was an easy $40.00 without drinks. Trip of a lifetime! Hard to find things open on Sunday nights??

Rocks a rip off. The Rocks area is good from a historical point of view, but avoid the markets there on a Sunday. Everything is very overpriced. We found the same with most of the eateries around the area. Certainly have a walk around the Rocks but go elsewhere to eat or shop.

The Rocks rocks!. Walk around the rocks and there are shops for you to buy from just Australia souvenirs and also opals. When you walk till the end which is the overseas passenger terminal, you can take picture of the Sydney bridge at background. and get a cup of coffee either at the Wolfies or Quay. then you will feel the sea breeze and the scene.
Touring & Walking. The Rocks Very good place tolook around, all the old Sydney buildings, markets, pubs, taverns, shopping in the different shops and also the museum near by to have a look.

The old Sidney!. Just at the back of the National Maritime Museum there is the oldest part of Sidney. It's very nice to appreciate the strong contrast between this old and nice building, the new skyscrapers and the bush in the back! It's worth to see it and to stop for a drink in one of these beautiful caffees.

favourite place in Sydney at the weekend. A vibrant area with loads of nice places to eat and drink. A bit similar to Covent Garden at the weekend. The weekend markets are worth a visit. Lots of cheap places for souvenirs. Very near the Quay so it is easy to get to. Some nice architecture and a great free museum too.

good place to wander. Took a walking tour with a guide who told us the history of The Rocks. Too many stairs for us so we eventually had to drop out. Very cool to discover hidden restaurants known to locals. Great outdoor market that closed at 5 p.m. on a Sat.

The Rocks rock!. Full of vibrant bars and eateries, this area is famous for a reason. You are spoilt for choice with one bar showcasing a jazz quintette and the next a clarinetist. And on and on. All serving great beers and wines and good food. An evening visit is a must.
Nice Markets. The rocks markets are always worth a visit, some really nice treasures can be found, but sometimes a wee bit pricey
Amazing historic district. I loved the rocks, full of history and quirky shops. Lots of character and pretty. Interesting buildings and bars.

The oldest part of Australia. This area is where Australia was first founded and contains very old buildings,narrow laneways,and great views of Sydney harbour,the opera house and the harbour bridge.Also you can view Cadmans cottage,the oldest building in Australia still standing.The only drawback to the area is the shops,restaurants and pubs charging over the top prices to the poor tourists,so keep your money in your pocket or you will be ripped off.There are much cheaper shops further uptown.The british flag was raised here in January,1788 to claim Australia for the British crown.

hot scene, day and night. On my last visit to Sydney I stayed at The Fours Season, which gave me direct access to this exciting part of the town, wherw I found great restaurants and lots of fun bars and cafés.

Weekend Market rule!. The Rocks is worth a weekend visit. Summer markets are starting and the selection of crafts, clothes and food is great. Food stalls meet the peckish demand and the choice of local artist, designer and craftsman items makes for a super day trip, often.

Favorite part of Sydney. Just love staying in the Rocks....it's like going back in time.
The real bonus is walking down cobbled lane ways that resemble Jack the Ripper country, and finding the most fantastic eateries and shops.
Do yourself a favor and have a wander in this beautiful part of Sydney
Our stop over after cruising the South pacific. Fantastic place with lots to do and plenty to see. Easy to get around whether by ferry or other forms of public transport.

Awesome place!. lots of historical architecture... great little shops for souveniers and eats... make sure to be here for the weekend market! TONS of authentic australian souveniers from local artists (not happy crappy type stuff, really well made crafts!). walking distance to circular quay, bridge, opera house - ideal location! book your hotel stay here!
Great place for souveniers. Lovely area with cobblestoned streets and pretty shops -filled in a few hours souvenier shopping and enjoyed lunch here.
Great markets. Found some great markets on Saturday. Great hustle and bustle atmosphere. Coffee was not over priced.
The Sat. market in The Rocks is well worth a stroll. Lots of food, jewelry, bags, soaps, etc. A great way to spend a few hours and to pick up a few gifts for everyone back home.

Perfect tourist location. We walked and took in the sites. Had lunch at The Waterfront restaurant on a scoop on/Groupon deal! Just perfect 3courses with a bottle of wine for under $80. Just being in the rocks is great...the markets pubs, opera house etc...

A bit of everything. We are often tourists in our own city,we visit the markets,have morning tea at The Tea Cosy coffee shop,and although we visit the area often we always find something new to investigate.Everybody should visit the area and support local business not foreign establishments like duty free stores that are supported by tourists .

Back in Time. A great place to travel back in to old Sydney. Lots of good restaurants, pubs and shops and the Sunday market is always fun with lots of locally hand made goods. Gets crowded at night and parking can be difficult.

Nice place to spend afternoon. Spent lovely afternoon in The Rocks following the Sydney Bridge Climb only a sort walk away. Plenty going on mainly market stalls but of a high quality with bars and cafés nearby. Chilled out afternoon with no high pressure selling.

Nice place to see. The Rocks in a nice scenic walk while weaving through the markets. You might stumble upon a museum or historical fact during your walk, but the market is what attracts people. The market is really great with handmade crafts and homemade food. Great to come here on a weekend.

The Rocks. We loved The Rocks area, stumbled upon a restaurant 'Sake' who made us so welcome, despite having no booking on a Saturday night. Fabulous food and very friendly and helpful staff.
When we return, we will be booking a table for dinner!!

looks like a european neighborhood. The rocks is one of the most beautiful places in Sydney. If you can't get a hotel there. Try to walk along the sydney harbour until you catch the road. the architecture reminds you of european style buildings.It's a classy fancy road with lots of eateries and shopping places
worthy trip. The place is indeed alive with activities and food galore during the day. And what particularly appealed to me is the carnival -like atmosphere.r

Love the atmosphere. I just love the Rocks especially on market days. As the weather gets warmer, there is a Farmer's market each Friday. If you go during lunch time, you should be prepared to wait for all the great food to be served eg sausages, gozleme. The food is a great alternative to the normal food courts or the cafes in the surrounding areas. What better way to chow down your food with a million dollar view to look at.During the weekends, the Rocks is abuzz with markets. I love the variety they have in the markets, ranging from paintings to clothing to souvenirs. Good spot to hunt for gifts for friends back home.After checking out the stalls and the area, you can walk around the Harbour and Circular Quay.
Interesting.. Did some shopping and had drinks in one of the many pavement cafes. Went up small alleyways and streets to find some interesting places.

superb place. Walking around the rocks gives you history of Sydney. Many small shops and little alleys are delightful. Some even have their own story and history, for example, Nurses Walk. Of all the things We did in Sydney (harbor cruise, city tour, casino, Opera House, Blue Mountains, etc.), this was the most enjoyable. When in Sydney, don't miss the rocks.
Nice to walk around especially the back streets. You get an idea of the way things were. Keep walking under the bridge for a different perspective and visit one of the restaurants in Walsh Bay
lovely spot. loads to do and look at the rocks such a nice place to visit a must do... loved it............ think Sydney is a beautiful city

Great place on Friday, Sat, and Sunday. They have a local market there, that has all kinds of crafts and hand made things. They also have some yummy food there too. It take a while to walk around and see everything. But, worth the time to do it. Great place to find gifts to take home to friends and family.

An Interesting Part of Sydney. I recently re-visited The Rocks after many years and had forgotten about its great little pubs, good shops, and the beauty of the magnificent tree-lined streets on the western side of the Bridge with its lovely heritage houses. Great for entertainment, or merely a pleasant walk with fantastic views.

A little history but more about shopping. They have done a nice job transforming what was a rundown area into one that refurbishes the buildings into space for shops. Worth walking around for a little bit of time.
Fun. Great weekend market. Good art galleries. Many options for lunch. If you happen to be there during the market take enjoy the variety of offerings.

Great place to walk and eat. we were in this area probably every night we were in Syndey, great pubs and eats. cute market on Saturdays and sundays from 10-5. only place in town where they serve food late.

Old Sydney. This is the oldest part of Sydney, Nice old building that have been kept clean and bright. The oldest street in Sydney starts here.
Great place to grab a drink and some food, as there as some great pubs.

The historical heart of the colony of New South Wales. A trip to Sydney would be poorer for not exploring the heritage of it's earliest settlement. Enjoy the alleys and passageways and the lovely architecture. Just remember that everything is at tourist prices. Walk up George Street to the business areas for cheaper food and to Pitt Street Mall for cheaper shopping and food with a greater range and options. Those who are interested will also note the absence of references to Australia's indigenous people in this area. This oversight is a sad reflection of the uneasy relationship Australia has with its original inhabitants to this day. That being said, the Rocks is an area of visual joy - don't just judge the buildings on their age but think about what the constructors had (or more tellingly, did not have) in terms of tools and resources to have created what they did. They you will truly enjoy how remarkable a place it is.

Don't miss the back streets and alleys.. Lots to see and do in the Rocks. Take your time and have a sturdy pair of shoes. There is lots to see in the back streets and alleys behind George Street. Lots of history and very nice eateries.
Mercantile Hotel. Always great in the Rocks and caught up with a Guinness at the Mercantile and was able to see AFL grand final at the Orient

the rocks. great place fantastic buildings fabulous food and markets easy to get around and not crowded many interseting things to see and marvel at how they built this place without all the mechanical gear we have today

A must see!. The rocks is right next the Opera house. There so much to see. Especially the ROCKS market. Its the best market you ever see, with lots of gift ideas and unusal items.
Love it!
erratic walking. Take you time to walk without a specific target. This is the best place for that in Sydney. The view of the bay is also nice
Good for history & atmosphere. This is a great place to walk & explore. I wouldn't recommend the ghost tour. Not worth the money, have been on better ghost tours for cheaper prices.

Great nice little place!. Walked to the Rocks from our hotel, an easy 15-20 minutes walk on a nice weather! It's like a nice old little town, oldest town in Sydney I think. Lots of shops and restaurants around, there are even museums and a flea market in the weekend. Great place to spend a nice Sunday afternoon in!

The heart of Sydney.. Lots of shops but the character of the area makes it nice. It is where Sydney started and a lovely place just to stroll around. Get lost in the lttle lanes and stop off in a cafe.
Attraction. Go on a weekend to experience the flea market. There is a good variety of handicrafts and original work. Just go there and soak the atmosphere.

Do not miss. This is the oldest settled area of Sydney and although it's only very young by the rest of the world's standards it is very beautiful with lost of shops and restaurants and beautiful original architecture.

Great place to go out socialising. Been out a few times to The Rocks on nights out and while Sydney is expensive compared to some spots you cannot underestimate the views that you get of the Sydney skyline especially in the Glenmoray. Overlooking Sydney Harbour whilst having a beer has been one of the highlights of my tour so far of Australia. If you are interested in history and the architecture then The Rocks is the place to go as it was the first Western settlement in Australia. Definitely should be on anybodies list of where to go whilst visiting Sydney
Great place to explore. Loved walking around the area. Great views of the bridge and the opera house. Lots of activity going on and places to eat
LOVE!. Great old pioneer vibe, very 1920's 30's. Lots of great spots to dine day and night and many historic buildings to check out too.

The rocks - quaint. Must visit on weekend to see all the great vendors. Many vendors offer unique gifts, handmade clothing and jewerly. It is nice to eat at a cafe outside. I would definately suggest to do while in Sydney.

Great views of the bridge and opera house. Stalls are open during weekends. There is a small museum and a small observatory. Recommended if you have no trouble walking and you like good views of the opera house and bridge

Loved this quaint part of Sydney. Loved this quaint part of Sydney. Here you can see lots of old buildings from convict times. I enjoyed all the tiny little crafty type shops and there are plenty of places to eat.
Worth a visit but go early. You can't visit Sydney without seeing the oldest neighbourhood but go early as shops and stalls close very early.

The Rocks Rock!. The Rocks really rock! Shopping is great, the food is good and the atomosphere is fantastic. You can take a great bike ride or go to a Sunday market place. You can access the Harbour Bridge for a walk or climb. Walk through some of the back streets that had a less than stellar reputation, in the early days of Sydney. Have a drink in a bar where sailors were drugged and kidnapped. Thank goodness someone had the good sense to perserve the area! Do not leave Sydney without a visit. Have plenty of cash, it is expensive!
Cute area. Cute area and a definite if you want to wander the boutiques and do some shopping. We walked around a bit and then walked over the harbour bridge.

Gorgeous place!. It's a beautiful place to visit. You have the rocks, the harbour bridge & circular quay all nearby. Wherever you look it's just stunning!! Markets on the weekend & food stalls with good quality food. Definitely worth a visit when in Sydney.
Lots of nice bars and restaurants. Good variety of bars and restaurants. Interesting and historic buildings together with a variety of shopping.

nice places and some to avoid. Dont travel to the Rocks when you are starving. There are so many options, you need to take your time to make your choice. We arrived from a walk from Circular Quay and ended up in a wee walkway where we found a bakery/restaurant called Bakers Oven Cafe. Try to avoid this one as the food is just terrible and totally overpriced. They have no idea of food and service is shocking. I know, it is a tourist spot but as long as the money coming from tourists is good enough one should deliver. I had a cesar salad which had nothing in common with the real thing. Ordinary mixed salad out of the bag, big stripes of awefull ham and cutted pieces with dry chicken and a readymade cesar salad sauce out of the bottle - that's it. I can't decribe the taste, left it uneaten on the plate. Hubby had a Panini with chicken which I thought was a sensible choice sitting in a bakery. Well, he didn't finish it either, the bread was stale, the chicken dry and even the slice tomato on it had seen better days. It sets us back AU$ 35.50 which I would rather have donated then wasted on crap food.

between the rocks and a hard place. Allow a day to wander around the rocks area. full of interesting little shops and alley ways. steeped in the history of Sydney (lots of nice pubs to rest weary legs in)

Fab. Just next to Darling Harbour is the Rocks which is the oldest part of Sydney and has the oldest pub, which is worth a visit. Here there are some exclusive shops and on a weekend there is a lovely market that fills a number of streets. Some reasonably priced cafes here too.

Quaint area. Boasts what claims to be the oldest pub in Sydney, a Coroners Court that is now an arts & crafts gallery, renovated old warehouses, and lovely views out over the harbour. An enjoyable place for an afternoon's wandering, plenty of souvenir shops and some rather exclusive retail opportunities. If you can, visit Susannah's Place, a row of 19th century houses and a shop, recreated and turned in to a small museum. We were not there at the right time, but it looked fascinating and we had a good chat with one of the custodians. Details on the Sydney for Free website, which also offers a leaflet at the tourist offices.

Amazing shopping experience, history, beauty in everything. A needs must when visiting Sydney, something for everyone, and so much about Australia to learn from in each and every little part, and history of it all
Cute area. Liked spending time there for the weekend markets, otherwise not much else to do there. No real shopping or eating there.

The best neighbourhood in Sydney!. The Rocks is a must attraction during any visit to Sydney. There are lots of bars and restaurants in the area offering an array of food options. The weekend markets are also quite nice to wandering through. Great location to Circular Quay and the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Markets History. The markets are on Sat/Sun good for tourists lots of Aussie gear.Have a walk around & read the History of the rocks area from the time the first fleet came today. Great pubs in the area.

Great pubs. If you like the old style sandstone pubs with lots of rowdy people then the Rocks is for you. For sure one of my top 5 pub crawl venues in the world, with lots of options including beer brewed on the premises and Irish bands. Top notch

Must Visit In Sydney.. The Rocks historical area of Sydney, is a must visit when in Sydney. The atmosphere is relaxed and the views from this part of the city are extremely worthwhile. Close to the harbour bridge, and lively stalls and shopping centre add to an area full of fun and tradition. Buskers entertain and Sydney Information Centre is located at The Rocks Centre.Just a short walk from Circular Quay (Overseas Terminal side of the harbour), pass by the monument statue of Governor William Bligh and see some historic buildings that have been fully restored.Visit the Rocks Discovery Museum if you have the time and at the weekends the markets are on.Art galleries and bike tours and lots of things can be seen and organised from the Rocks.Trendy while being historic, The Rocks has a warm and friendly atmosphere, and the aromas of coffee and food from the stalls adds to this fascinating area. Take a stroll along any of the roads around The Rocks and you'll be surprised at the views you get from this area.Souvenirs from the information centre as well as plenty of brochures and assistance from staff on what to do and where to go in New South wales. Very enjoyable and worth visiting.

The Rocks full of history. This old district of Sydney offers nice bars, restaurant and markets. It does atract many tourist, but really is worth a visit. Plenty of places to buy your UGG Boots and soveniers. Well worth a visit specially after climbing Sydney Bridge as the entrance for the climb is in the Rocks.
Middle of it all. Great place to stay walking distance from everything and with some amazing places to eat and DRINK in and around there :) Not to mention the views!

Great place with lots of eateries and so much history behind it.. The Rocks is a great place, lots of places to eat to suit all tastes. Heaps of pubs with decent prices drinks which is rare in Sydney - usually so expensive!
Lots of things to see and do and if you are a history buff like me then you'll love it!
Nice restaurants, bars and market. This old district of Sydney offers some nice bars, restaurant and market. It does atract many tourist, but really is worth a visit.
